Events.description:
DetailsI though we'd do something that won't involve puddles or mud and will get some fresh salty air into our lungs.
We'll start from Portsmouth Harbour rail station, meeting on the steps as you come out of the station by the bus terminal. Our walk will take us through Gunwharf Quays out to Old Portsmouth following the Millenium Trail as best we can. A detour around Spice Island and then along the sea defences (depending if they are open!). If not open a detour past the derelict church and Old Portsmouth side streets to rejoin the promenade at Clarence Pier (anyone wanting crispy funfair donuts or candy floss then we can stop!). On down to the D-Day Museum along the promenade. Toilet facilities here if needed, then we can turn around and wander back to Gunwharf for lunch somewhere.
Walking time approx 2.5 hours allowed and distance around 5 miles (2.5 out and 2.5 back). Nothing strenuous and no hills or mud (I hope!).
Numbers restricted to 16 as this is my first time hosting a walk.
I hope I've covered everything! If you want to play it by ear with me then I'd love to have you along for a laugh at what I get wrong.
Event Last Updated: 2024-03-25T18:36:08.576Z
Events.location: Needs a location

Events.summary: Emergency First Aid at Work - One Day FAIB Accredited Course
Events.description:
Access to effective, topical, and thematic training, that ensures externally accredited compliance, is at the heart of developing good business practice.

Responding to feedback from members, the Chamber has partnered with Good Skills Training Ltd to deliver a suite of workplace compliance courses. Supported by Fareham College, this partnership will help ensure that employers in our network with more than 5 staff can fulfil their legal obligations while businesses of any kind are supported to create a safe and accessible workplace environment.¬†



Emergency First Aid at Work Course - One Day

Everyone should know a little first aid to be able to assist in an emergency. The Emergency First Aid at Work Course gives people the knowledge that could one day save a life.

Designed specifically with smaller low risk companies in mind, such as small offices, the Emergency First Aid at Work Course meets the legal obligations of these organisations to provide individuals to render first aid in an emergency.

This course is accredited by The First Aid Industry Body

Refreshments and Lunch will be provided -¬†If you have a dietary requirement, please let us know by using the 'Special Request' box, indicated with a speech bubble icon, available after adding a ticket to your basket.


Emergency First Aid at Work Course Syllabus

	Responsibilities of the Emergency First Aider
	Primary Assessment
	Secondary Assessment
	CPR & AED
	Seizures and Epilepsy
	Choking
	Shock and Bleeding
	Minor Injuries and Minor Burns
	Plus more

Emergency First Aid at Work Course Assessment Process

This course is assessed through a mixture of practical assessments and theoretical, multiple choice assessments.

Emergency First Aid at Work Course Renewal Process

It is strongly recommended that first aiders undergo an annual ¬Ω day First Aid Refresher Course to keep their skills up to date.

After three years‚Äô delegates must retake an Emergency First Aid at Work Course to keep their qualification valid.

Good Skills Training Ltd.

https://goodskillstraining.co.uk/

Good Skills Training bring quality and affordable training and consultancy services to businesses, schools and individuals across Hampshire and the Isle of Wight.
They believe your compliance training should be fun and engaging as well as informative and relevant to your business.
¬†
They offer a full range of training, Health and Safety Services including generic Health and Safety courses, Risk Assessment Training, First Aid Training, COSHH and IOSH.
All courses meet the relevant guidelines for Health and Safety, First Aid and Safeguarding and are fully certificated.

Detailshttps://www.facebook.com/groups/988754058344754/?ref=share_group_link
Bring some games if you want.. start your own table and see who wants to play or have a wander around and join another..
if you have games you wish to sell, bring them along with cost and contact details on a sheet of paper so people can find you to purchase..
Doors open @ 19.00 once I've opened up and put some tables out. Entry ¬£3 per person.
Snacks and fizzy cans will be available (cash or paypal). Free tea and coffee (bring a mug).
FREE game give away will take place during the evening. one free ticket on entry, additional tickets are available to purchase @50p. At least one prize ticket will be pulled around 10pm. there will also three rounds of higher or lower to win free entry for two to the next meet up.
Rules
Adults only, no more needs to be said.
There will be a charge for the monthly hall evening event of ¬£3, payment on arrival. the hall has a capacity of 90 so it's first come, first entry. Once capacity is reached we can not let others in, sorry. Capacity seems to be about 60, depending on how many seats around the tables.
You will be offered a loyalty card on arrival is you don't have one. stamp on an empty space and when you have 5 stamps, the 6th visit is free.
Bring some money (coins) for the above plus the opportunity to enter a raffle to win a game and you can buy drinks and snacks. also to buy any games that are being sold by others.
No alcohol. Soft drinks only. Guests found with alcohol will be politely asked to leave. Cans will be available to purchase on the night but feel free to bring your own should you wish. There will be FREE tea and coffee facilities available, bring your own mug!
Abusive and threatening behaviour will not be tolerated. Don't be a dick, you will be asked to leave.
Respect the property, this is a shared hall used by many groups. Treat it like you would your home (or if your home is a mess, my home). Tidy up after yourself and clean up if you make a mess.
Look after the games. People have spent their hard earned cash buying games that you may play. Be respectful of that.
No cheating.. no cards up sleeves, mirrors or any kind of 'Rain Man' activities please üòÅ
If you play a game and the group finish, pack it away before moving on to another...
What happens at the table stays at the table.. Yes someone might make a dick move or win hands down but remember it's just a game.. Tantrums such as throwing dice, game pieces, banging or kicking the table etc will not be tolerated and you may be asked to leave.
Mostly HAVE FUN !!!!

Events.summary: GoodGym Portsmouth // Group Session // Do Good & Get Fit
Events.description:
PLEASE VISIT THE WEBSITE TO CONFIRM SESSION DETAILS AND LET US KNOW YOU PLAN TO ATTEND. THIS IS MANDATORY.
Want to do something useful with your exercise? GoodGym is no ordinary gym. We're a group of people who get fit by doing good - helping out local charities and community groups with physical jobs like shifting compost and planting trees.
üìç We meet at Morrison's supermarket, Anchorage Road, Portsmouth, PO3 5UH at 6:00pm.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è At 6:15pm we'll run, walk or cycle to do a 30-40 minute task.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Then we'll head back to where we started by 7:45pm, do some stretches and maybe grab a beverage?
It's FREE. It's fun. It's fulfilling. And we're a very friendly bunch. üçá
‚Äî
BOOK ONTO THE SESSION
To come to the session click here: https://www.goodgym.org/areas/portsmouth/happenings
You will need to confirm your attendance on the GoodGym website (this includes creating an account with us if you haven‚Äôt already - it only takes a few mins).
The link above takes you to the session listings in your area - if this session doesn‚Äôt fit your schedule, you may find something that does so check it out.
p.s. GoodGym is a charity and you will be asked whether you‚Äôd like to donate when first creating an account. The choice is yours and does not affect your ability to attend a session.
‚Äî
FAQ
Not sure you'll keep up? GoodGym is for everyone (18+). Whether you've never run before, or are chasing a marathon PB, you are 100% welcome. We always have a back-marker so no one gets left behind.
70% of GoodGym members start as non-runners so if you're new to this kind of thing you will be supported by people who are all on the same journey. üëç
What do I need to wear? Most of us wear gym/running gear. Make sure you're prepared for the weather.
Don't feel like you're fit enough? Our tasks are simple and fun. There are easy jobs as well as more challenging things for those who want a workout! The choice is always yours.
Do I need to bring anything? Gardening gloves are really useful for a lot of GoodGym tasks. And a head torch too if it‚Äôs likely to get dark. Please bring some if you can but there‚Äôs no requirement üß§üí°üß§
What is GoodGym? We're a (really lovely) group of people who use our energy to make a difference in our local community (and in communities across the UK!). We often meet on a weeknight, at least once a week, for a session to do good and get fit. We'd love you to come and join us. Any questions, just pop a comment below or send me a message. Find out everything you need to know at goodgym.org
Event Last Updated: 2024-05-01T00:00:22.998Z
Events.location: Morrisons, Anchorage Road, Portsmouth

Details## Details
Never been sailing? Would love to try? Not sure if it is for you?
Then come sailing with us for the day in the sheltered waters of the Solent.
We are moored in Haslar Marina, Gosport. Meet at 9.00 and come on board.
First thing will be the safety brief - you will be shown around so that you become familiar with the yacht and how things work. We will then head out, hoist some sails and start sailing. You will be able to have a go at setting the sails and at helming - it's your day so ask as many questions as you want.
We will most likely sail to Cowes on the Isle of Wight, moor up for lunch on board then sail back to Haslar marina, giving you the opportunity to practise your new skills.
We only sell 4 places so a great opportunity for everyone to have a go.
Our yacht is a modern Dufour 385 Grande Large MCA coded yacht with all safety equipment.
We are RYA qualified experienced sailors who want to share our passion for sailing.
The cost for the day is ¬£90 which includes a snack lunch, tea, coffee, soft drinks and waterproofs. There are no hidden extras.
Interested? If you would like more information please contact Maggie on [0771 2525368](tel:0771 2525368) or Chris on [07751 212976](tel:07751 212976).
If you RSVP you MUST email maggiesmith77@hotmail.com to book.
A ¬£30 deposit secures your place with the balance of ¬£60 due 28 days before the event.

Events.summary: Solent Speakers Club - a safe and friendly place to speak!
Events.description:
DetailsDo you fear public speaking?
Do you want to improve your communication and leadership skills?
Do you need to find a way to settle your nerves in presentations, meetings and interviews?
Do you lack ¬£¬£¬£ to spend on corporate courses?
If you live in or near the Fareham area, Solent Speakers is the club for you! Come and practise in a safe and supportive environment. Our club is renowned for being friendly and we always back each other; we share the same nerves and the same desire to continuously improve ourselves and those around us. We meet on the first and third Tuesday of each month. If you can't attend in person, there is an option to join via Zoom - post a comment below (on this event page) to ask for the link and passcode.
We are affiliated to Toastmasters International. As a not-for-profit organisation, it has helped to nurture the best public speakers in the world! You could be a part of that and if you are new to Toastmasters come along to our meetings for FREE! Join us for an evening you will always remember as the first time you took that brave new step.

Events.summary: Millenium Way Walk - Gunwharf Quays to D-D Museum
Events.description:
This was a walk that was going to take place in March, but due to bad weather, I took the decision to postpone it. Hopefully we'll get a good day on this walk!
We will start from the steps of Portsmouth Harbour rail station where you can see views over to Gosport and the Naval Dockyard where the Warrior, Nelson's Victory and Henry VIII's Mary Rose are all in residence.
We'll walk the Millenium trail through Gunwharf Quays, out and around Old Portsmouth and then up onto the Hot Walls (if shut due to sea defence work then we'll walk at ground level until we can get onto the Walls. The walk then takes us past Clarence Pier (anyone wanting donuts at the fair we'll wait for you!), then down along the seafront to our destination, the D-Day Museum. We can stop here for refreshments - either in the Museum or in Southsea Castle. We then head back to Gunwharf. I estimate the walk in total being around 2.5 miles each way, depending on if we cut corners en route.
Dogs are welcome if kept on a lead as this is a busy area.
Event Last Updated: 2024-04-30T00:00:27.259Z
Events.location: Portsmouth Harbour, The Hard Interchange, Portsmouth

Events.summary: Hayling Billy Trail Stroll (approx 2.5 miles with an additional walk option)
Events.description:
A gentle evening stroll starting from the car park on the Hayling Billy Trail, which is behind the Esso Garage on Havant Road, Hayling Island (sign posted "Nature Reserve"). Please don't park in the Esso Garage as there's no access to the car park from here. There's a little road just past the garage that takes you to the car park on the shoreline.
We'll walk south down the trail for approx 45-50 minutes, see how far we get, then turn around and wander back. If we get back and you all still feel like a bit more of a wander, we can walk north along the Oyster Beds and up to the signal by the Bridge, then back to the car park. It all depends on how people are feeling after the first circuit. The second loop going north probably won't take more than another 45 minutes.
Dogs are welcome but please keep your owners in check because the trail is accessible for bikers and horseriders too.

Events.summary: GoodGym Portsmouth // Group Session // Do Good & Get Fit
Events.description:
PLEASE VISIT THE WEBSITE TO CONFIRM SESSION DETAILS AND LET US KNOW YOU PLAN TO ATTEND. THIS IS MANDATORY.
Want to do something useful with your exercise? GoodGym is no ordinary gym. We're a group of people who get fit by doing good - helping out local charities and community groups with physical jobs like shifting compost and planting trees.
üìç We meet at Morrison's supermarket, Anchorage Road, Portsmouth, PO3 5UH at 6:00pm.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è At 6:15pm we'll run, walk or cycle to do a 30-40 minute task.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Then we'll head back to where we started by 7:45pm, do some stretches and maybe grab a beverage?
It's FREE. It's fun. It's fulfilling. And we're a very friendly bunch. üçá
‚Äî
BOOK ONTO THE SESSION
To come to the session click here: https://www.goodgym.org/areas/portsmouth/happenings
You will need to confirm your attendance on the GoodGym website (this includes creating an account with us if you haven‚Äôt already - it only takes a few mins).
The link above takes you to the session listings in your area - if this session doesn‚Äôt fit your schedule, you may find something that does so check it out.
p.s. GoodGym is a charity and you will be asked whether you‚Äôd like to donate when first creating an account. The choice is yours and does not affect your ability to attend a session.
‚Äî
FAQ
Not sure you'll keep up? GoodGym is for everyone (18+). Whether you've never run before, or are chasing a marathon PB, you are 100% welcome. We always have a back-marker so no one gets left behind.
70% of GoodGym members start as non-runners so if you're new to this kind of thing you will be supported by people who are all on the same journey. üëç
What do I need to wear? Most of us wear gym/running gear. Make sure you're prepared for the weather.
Don't feel like you're fit enough? Our tasks are simple and fun. There are easy jobs as well as more challenging things for those who want a workout! The choice is always yours.
Do I need to bring anything? Gardening gloves are really useful for a lot of GoodGym tasks. And a head torch too if it‚Äôs likely to get dark. Please bring some if you can but there‚Äôs no requirement üß§üí°üß§
What is GoodGym? We're a (really lovely) group of people who use our energy to make a difference in our local community (and in communities across the UK!). We often meet on a weeknight, at least once a week, for a session to do good and get fit. We'd love you to come and join us. Any questions, just pop a comment below or send me a message. Find out everything you need to know at goodgym.org

Events.description:
How Speed Dating Works in Portsmouth
When you arrive at the Portsmouth venue you will be greeted by our friendly professional hosts. Once everyone has arrived and registered we will briefly explain the format of the evening. The ladies will then be asked to make their way to their allocated table. Once the ladies are seated the gentlemen will be asked to proceed to their first date.
You will have 4 minutes to chat to each date, once the 4 minutes is over we will ring a bell to indicate the time is up and for the gentlemen to move to their next date. Four minutes is long enough to see if you click with the person you are talking to and whether you would like to see them again and also short enough if you don't.
At the end of each date you have a brief few moments to make some notes on the person you have just dated. This is something to help jog your memory for the post event matching process the next day.
Half way through the event you will have an interval break so you can nip to the toilet or top up your drink.
Once all the dates are over you have the opportunity to stay on at the venue to mingle freely with others. Please remember to take your dating card home with you to assist you in entering in your ticks and potential matches.
Post Event
No later than 11am the following morning our matching system will be unlocked for you to enter your ticks from the previous evening. You have all day to tick as many people as you like from the night before. We guarantee you will find someone you will want to see again, otherwise we will give you your next Speed Dating event for free!
IMPORTANT: The number of attendees on MeetUp doesn`t reflect the real situation as we sell the majority of tickets on other platforms. Please bear this in mind. You can find more information here: https://bit.ly/3dm7Lju
Please note that our bookings team work standard UK business hours - if you book outside of these hours, your confirmation from Slowdating will be processed once the bookings team are in.

Events.description:
Thank you for clicking on our event.
We are the Portsmouth, UK Toastmasters Club 'Spinnaker Speakers'.
We are a welcoming, friendly and supportive group of people who are all passionate about improving our speaking skills and helping others to achieve their goals.
We currently meet twice a month - 2nd & 4th Monday (no meetings on Bank Holidays) - in Portsmouth Opposite the Hard Interchange.
You are warmly invited to come along to one of our meetings as a guest, for free, regardless of your current ability level, to see what we are about and find out how you can build your confidence through learning and developing the following skills:
- Public Speaking
- Presentation
- Leadership
Our club is part of the worldwide Toastmasters International organisation that has been helping people learn to be more confident speakers for over 90 years.
Each meeting is fun, engaging and interesting, with Guests always being offered the opportunity, along with our Members, to participate in our impromptu speaking session - 'Table Topics'.
Anyone over the age of 18 is welcome. We have a diverse and open-minded paid membership from all walks of life and Toastmasters has changed many people's lives. Will yours be next?
Please feel free to contact us for more details without any pressure or obligation.
We understand that many people who first contact us are nervous, so please know that you will always receive a warm welcome both before and at our meetings.

Events.summary: GoodGym Portsmouth // Group Session // Do Good & Get Fit
Events.description:
PLEASE VISIT THE WEBSITE TO CONFIRM SESSION DETAILS AND LET US KNOW YOU PLAN TO ATTEND. THIS IS MANDATORY.
Want to do something useful with your exercise? GoodGym is no ordinary gym. We're a group of people who get fit by doing good - helping out local charities and community groups with physical jobs like shifting compost and planting trees.
üìç We meet at Morrison's supermarket, Anchorage Road, Portsmouth, PO3 5UH at 6:00pm.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è At 6:15pm we'll run, walk or cycle to do a 30-40 minute task.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Then we'll head back to where we started by 7:45pm, do some stretches and maybe grab a beverage?
It's FREE. It's fun. It's fulfilling. And we're a very friendly bunch. üçá
‚Äî
BOOK ONTO THE SESSION
To come to the session click here: https://www.goodgym.org/areas/portsmouth/happenings
You will need to confirm your attendance on the GoodGym website (this includes creating an account with us if you haven‚Äôt already - it only takes a few mins).
The link above takes you to the session listings in your area - if this session doesn‚Äôt fit your schedule, you may find something that does so check it out.
p.s. GoodGym is a charity and you will be asked whether you‚Äôd like to donate when first creating an account. The choice is yours and does not affect your ability to attend a session.
‚Äî
FAQ
Not sure you'll keep up? GoodGym is for everyone (18+). Whether you've never run before, or are chasing a marathon PB, you are 100% welcome. We always have a back-marker so no one gets left behind.
70% of GoodGym members start as non-runners so if you're new to this kind of thing you will be supported by people who are all on the same journey. üëç
What do I need to wear? Most of us wear gym/running gear. Make sure you're prepared for the weather.
Don't feel like you're fit enough? Our tasks are simple and fun. There are easy jobs as well as more challenging things for those who want a workout! The choice is always yours.
Do I need to bring anything? Gardening gloves are really useful for a lot of GoodGym tasks. And a head torch too if it‚Äôs likely to get dark. Please bring some if you can but there‚Äôs no requirement üß§üí°üß§
What is GoodGym? We're a (really lovely) group of people who use our energy to make a difference in our local community (and in communities across the UK!). We often meet on a weeknight, at least once a week, for a session to do good and get fit. We'd love you to come and join us. Any questions, just pop a comment below or send me a message. Find out everything you need to know at goodgym.org

Events.summary: Rowlands Castle Hampshire Sussex Borders Explorer - 18 miles (29 kilometres)
Events.description:
DetailsToday's Love To Hike Plus is the seventh of this year's faster-paced Love To Hikes for those who prefer to hike 15% faster than the normal Love To Hike pace, and consequently finish at least one hour earlier.
The circular 18 miles (29 kilometres) route starts and finishes in Rowlands Castle, a village on the Hampshire West Sussex border. The village takes its name from a motte-and-bailey castle built sometime between 1066 and 1189, but was subsequently abandoned by the 15th century.
The beautiful, rural, picturesque, route passes through numerous woods and open fields in this part of East Hampshire and West Sussex including stretches of the South Downs Way and Monarch Way. At this time of year, the Autumn colours will be near their best.
There are 560m of climbing.
Lunch: Picnic.
Drivers: Car park at Rowlands Castle station.
Toilets: Please use the toilets on the train before you arrive as there are none at the station.
Price: ¬£12 per person for a full day‚Äôs hike guided by Giles Brokensha.
Note: The price of the hike excludes transport, parking, and lunch.
Mobile for the day: 07916 336702.
Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/527954508076020/ - please join and like.
ROUTE
From the station, we head initially south before heading east to hike along the outskirts of the Stansted Forest heading towards the village of South Harting, and the South Downs.
After passing through Markwells Wood, Compton Down, and West Harting Down, we reach the outskirts of South Harting. Here we join the South Downs Way heading south-east through the woods on Harting Hill.
At North Marden Down, we turn south-westerly heading for the villages of Compton and West Marden.
We continue in a south-westerly direction, and close to Stansted Forest, we join Monarch Way, which we follow along the southern border of Stansted Forest back to the station.
LUNCH
Lunch will be a picnic at a suitable location between 12:30-13:00.
TRAINS
Depart: Leaves London Waterloo at 0757 to arrive at Rowlands Castle at 0923. You must change trains at Haslemere. The train from London Waterloo arrives in Haslemere at 0853, and the train to Rowlands Castle leaves Haslemere at 0857. You can also join the first train at Woking (0824), and Guildford (0832).
Return: Trains to London Waterloo leave Rowlands Castle at 28 minutes past the hour and take 85 minutes.
Train fare: The off-peak return fare from London Waterloo to Rowlands Castle is ¬£33.80. With GroupSave, the price per person for a group of 3 to 9 is reduced by 34% to only ¬£22.31.
If you would like to form a group, please post a comment on this site and arrange to meet under the clock at London Waterloo station by 0745 at the latest.
DRIVERS
From the A3, turn onto to the B2149. Once in Rowlands Castle, turn left into Redhill Road which will take you to the station car park.
Any driver willing to offer a lift, or any passenger seeking a lift, please post a comment with your location and contact details. Passengers, please remember to offer your chauffeur a contribution towards fuel and parking costs.
WHAT TO BRING
¬∑ Hand sanitiser.
¬∑ Sturdy, waterproof hiking boots that have been broken-in, ideally with ankle support. No trainers.
¬∑ Waterproof jacket: whatever the weather, we hike.
¬∑ Water: 2 litres minimum.
¬∑ Pre-packed picnic lunch and snacks: it‚Äôs a long hike.
¬∑ Day pack.
¬∑ Long trousers: zip-offs are perfect for warm days.
¬∑ Sun hat and sunglasses if sunny.
¬∑ Gaiters or waterproof over trousers if rain is expected.
¬∑ Dry base layer for the journey home.
PRICE
¬£12 per person payable in advance upon booking for a full day‚Äôs hike guided by Giles Brokensha.
BOOKING
To book, click on the ‚ÄòYes‚Äô button just below ‚ÄòAre you going?‚Äô in the top right hand corner. You can pay from either your PayPal account or with your debit or credit card.
CANCELLATIONS
When you cancel seven or more days before a Love To Hike, you receive a ¬£12 credit towards any future Love To Hike event.
DISCLAIMER
When participating in any outdoor activity, there is always the risk of injury and death. When hiking with Love To Hike, you acknowledge that:

You are fully aware of all of the risks involved and accept full responsibility for whatever may happen to you during or after the hike.
You are in good health, ‚Äòfit to hike‚Äô and capable of keeping the pace for the duration of the hike.
You shall wear sturdy hiking boots that have been broken-in, are in good condition (not brand new), and clothing that is appropriate for the time of year and any weather conditions that may arise during the hike.
You shall not hold responsible, nor pursue any legal, injury or financial compensation claim against Love To Hike and or the hike leader for anything that may happen to you during or after the hike.

Experience vs Newbies, let me explain:
For the experienced, take charge of navigating helming and sail trimming. The skipper will discuss your plans with you and once agreed will only step in whilst in confined spaces or to enhance the safety of the boat or crew.
For the beginners the objective is to demystify how to sail the yacht and get you up to speed where you can sail with confidence with someone of experience at your side. The great thing about the extended cruising weekend is that you'll build your sailing experience to another level.
Once moored up we are all on a mini break so either join your new friends in socialising over something cool or feel free to explore our stop over points.
Rough Itinerary [more detailed version will be posted out nearer the time]
Thursday evening meetup aboard Wolverine [Gosport PO12 1NU] at 7pm for sail briefing and settle down for a night sail to our first destination.
Sometime on Friday arrive at our destination point and settle in for the rest of the day
Friday: night stop over in a Marina
Saturday: explore our destination or move on to another port with Saturday night stop over.
Sunday: explore or rest during the day.
Monday: sail over night back to Gosport.
The four day sailing trip cost is ¬£500pp, spaces are unfortunately limited, so sign up as soon as you are able.
What's included:
Skipper, Yacht, tea and coffee and all of the safety equipment.
What's excluded:
Food and Drink / fuel / berthing fees, which we will divide this up amongst the crew at the end of the trip.
To join us in this exciting trip just hit the RSVP button and we'll do the rest!
Cancellation policy
Rule 1: If the weather is unsafe and we have to cancel then its your choice to either have a full refund or the priority option for the next cruise that suits you.
Rule 2: If you have to cancel before two calendar weeks before the trip, you are entitled to a full refund.
Rule 3: If you have to cancel within 2 weeks of then instead of forfeiting your payment, we'll roll your booking and payment over to the next trip, can't say fairer than that.

Events.summary: Havant Coastal Walk for cancer loss, Hampshire, 12.5.24
Events.description:
On Sunday 12th May 2024 we will be hosting an informal walk and talk event around the Havant Coast.
This event is specifically for people who have lost a loved one to cancer. This event is for people aged 18 and over.
Where are we walking?
The walk will start in Havant and follow the Hayling Billy Trail south to Chichester Harbour. If the tide allows we will head along the beach to Warblington then return back. It will last approximately an hour.
Can anyone take part?
Our walk is open to any adult who has had a loved one die from cancer. The aim is to give you space to meet and talk with others who have experienced a similar loss, which our users tell us they find extremely helpful.
We will be limiting the number of walkers to 11 people so that we do not have too large a walking group. One of our volunteers will be hosting the event to walk and talk alongside you.
Please note that we do not allow guests unless you let us know in advance (as we are capping the number of attendees for each walk).
Pets and children are also not able to attend.
What are the timings for the day?
Walkers will be meeting at 10:00am and starting at 10:15am.
We aim to complete the walk, at approximately 11:15am.
Do I need to be a professional walker?
Definitely not. The event is about being together, spending time with others who have experienced similar things, and being outdoors. It‚Äôs not about being fit or racing.
How do I get involved?
To register for this event you will need to complete the registration form below:
https://survey.eu.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_8cSBSkXKNiQLNfU
Once completed you will receive an email confirming your place and with full details for the walk.
We are unable to respond to messages through MeetUp outside of office working hours. If you are having any difficulty with registering for the group, please email us at hello@thelossfoundation.org rather than through MeetUp and we will get back to you as soon as we can.
Please note that we are not a crisis service, so if you are in need of immediate support please do reach out to Samaritans who provide immediate listening support. They can be reached on 116 123.
Event Last Updated: 2024-05-12T00:00:41.135Z
Events.location: The Spring Arts & Heritage Centre, 56 East Street, Havant

For our first talk, we are thrilled to be hosting Jeremy Horne, Founder and Director at Datacove. People often wonder how marketing can be measured - where to put my money, how I know whether channels work, whether TV now just a dead platform?! Events.summary: The Early April 2023 Portsmouth Guitar Jam
Events.description:
DetailsCome and enjoy a night of Jammin' with us on the evening of Tuesday 9th April.
We have had a cracking last few meetups and this one is going to be no exception!
Celebrate with a beer and some fun tunes. It doesn't matter what standard you are - everything we play can be played by anyone with a basic ability for chords!
We have a few song books so we can also play some old classics!
We'll tune up, assess standards and then start playing.
These days we are starting with a 12 bar blues jam (in A Major usually) which gets us going and allow everyone to find their feet. We have been building a playlist and so far it includes things like:

Sunny Afternoon - Kinks
A Santana style jam
Hotel California
Wish You Were Here
Saw Her Standing There - Beatles
After Midnight - JJ Cale
Maggie May - Rod Stewart
Handbags and Gladrags
Folsom Prison Blues - Johnny Cash
Into the Mystic - Van Morrison
The Chain - Fleetwood Mac
The Man who Sold the World - Bowie

Full list is here
If there is something you want to play then we'll have a crack at that too - we always like to try something new - and suggestions have been as diverse as Dolly Parton (Jolene) and George Michael - and all were a blast!
The Dolphin is a nice pub in Old Portsmouth - it serves food and some nice beers. We will be in the upstairs room.
The more the merrier - so come along whatever your standard (I am distinctly intermediate!) - we play songs that pretty much anyone can play.
If you use Ultimate Guitar Tabs you can also see the tabs we are playing HERE.
If you can, bring a tablet/phone/laptop to bring tabs up on.
Most importantly, bring a couple of songs that you want to play!
We look forward to welcoming you!

Events.summary: Science Discovery Group - Why do we eat what we eat?
Events.description:
One with those with a fascination for the science of exploring human diets delivered by Dr Mark Chapman, Associate Professor, University of Southampton to the Science Discovery Group in Emsworth near Portsmouth.
VENUE:
Meet in room Mountford 1, Emsworth Community Centre, Church Path, Emsworth PO10 7DP
SUMMARY:
We rely on a surprisingly narrow amount of genetic diversity (both in terms of the range of crops, and the varieties of each) for our food. I will discuss how our understanding of evolutionary processes more generally can lead to conclusions (or at least hypotheses!) about why this is. I will also discuss our growing understanding of so-called ‚Äòunderutilised‚Äô or ‚Äòforgotten‚Äô crops.
BUY TICKETS:
To attend a meeting on Zoom you will need to buy a ticket by clicking the button in the relevant SDG email. You will need to subscribe to the SDG email list to receive our emails. Subscribe by entering your details on our contact page.
‚Äã
When you buy a ticket you will get an email from orders@SimpleTix.com with your personal link to the Zoom meeting. If you do not see this email in your inbox please check your Spam/Junk folder. SimpleTix will also send you reminders for the meeting which also contain your meeting link. When the meeting starts simply click on the link in your email.
‚Äã
When you join the Zoom meeting you will be muted and unable to use your microphone, this is to avoid remote participant inadvertently interrupting the meeting. You will be able to see and hear the speaker and also see their slides. Please type any questions you might have into the chat.
Please note the charge is now ¬£4
We look forward to seeing you there but if you cannot make it, you can buy a ticket to listen on Zoom above.
Kevin and Annie

Events.summary: GoodGym Portsmouth // Group Session // Do Good & Get Fit
Events.description:
PLEASE VISIT THE WEBSITE TO CONFIRM SESSION DETAILS AND LET US KNOW YOU PLAN TO ATTEND. THIS IS MANDATORY.
Want to do something useful with your exercise? GoodGym is no ordinary gym. We're a group of people who get fit by doing good - helping out local charities and community groups with physical jobs like shifting compost and planting trees.
üìç We meet at Morrison's supermarket, Anchorage Road, Portsmouth, PO3 5UH at 6:00pm.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è At 6:15pm we'll run, walk or cycle to do a 30-40 minute task.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Then we'll head back to where we started by 7:45pm, do some stretches and maybe grab a beverage?
It's FREE. It's fun. It's fulfilling. And we're a very friendly bunch. üçá
‚Äî
BOOK ONTO THE SESSION
To come to the session click here: https://www.goodgym.org/areas/portsmouth/happenings
You will need to confirm your attendance on the GoodGym website (this includes creating an account with us if you haven‚Äôt already - it only takes a few mins).
The link above takes you to the session listings in your area - if this session doesn‚Äôt fit your schedule, you may find something that does so check it out.
p.s. GoodGym is a charity and you will be asked whether you‚Äôd like to donate when first creating an account. The choice is yours and does not affect your ability to attend a session.
‚Äî
FAQ
Not sure you'll keep up? GoodGym is for everyone (18+). Whether you've never run before, or are chasing a marathon PB, you are 100% welcome. We always have a back-marker so no one gets left behind.
70% of GoodGym members start as non-runners so if you're new to this kind of thing you will be supported by people who are all on the same journey. üëç
What do I need to wear? Most of us wear gym/running gear. Make sure you're prepared for the weather.
Don't feel like you're fit enough? Our tasks are simple and fun. There are easy jobs as well as more challenging things for those who want a workout! The choice is always yours.
Do I need to bring anything? Gardening gloves are really useful for a lot of GoodGym tasks. And a head torch too if it‚Äôs likely to get dark. Please bring some if you can but there‚Äôs no requirement üß§üí°üß§
What is GoodGym? We're a (really lovely) group of people who use our energy to make a difference in our local community (and in communities across the UK!). We often meet on a weeknight, at least once a week, for a session to do good and get fit. We'd love you to come and join us. Any questions, just pop a comment below or send me a message. Find out everything you need to know at goodgym.org
Event Last Updated: 2024-05-15T00:02:12.666Z
Events.location: Morrisons, Anchorage Road, Portsmouth

Events.description:
Come and join us as we bring out our inner laughter together. This is a friendly and welcoming group, where laughter is the name of the game. No experience necessary.
At a laughter club, we'll be invited to join in with some light-hearted games, activities and meditations that encourage natural laughter and playfulness. You'll feel energised and invigorated, and can share conversation over a drink afterwards with your fellow laughers.
The club is open to all adults who have a willingness to try something new and fun. The proven benefits of laughter yoga include mood elevation, stress reduction, increased energy, emotional balance and increased immunity. Deep belly laughing is also great exercise.
The Serenity Complementary Centre is an ideal venue, with free parking in the small car park and on-street. Wear normal, comfortable clothing and expect serious fun.
Sessions are ¬£7 including refreshments. Come and connect with others as we experience the benefits of real laughter together.

Events.summary: Discuss Tomorrow, and tomorrow, and tomorrow by Gabrielle Zevin
Events.description:
This is the story of Sam and Sadie. It's not a romance, but it is about love.
When Sam catches sight of Sadie at a crowded train station one morning he is catapulted straight back to childhood, and the hours they spent immersed in playing games.
Their spark is instantly reignited and sets off a creative collaboration that will make them superstars. It is the 90s, and anything is possible.
What comes next is a decades-long tale of friendship and rivalry, fame and art, betrayal and tragedy, perfect worlds and imperfect ones. And, above all, our need to connect: to be loved and to love.

The arts trail started 20 years ago with just 10 artists and has now grown to 95, exhibiting oil, acrylic and watercolour paintings, photographs, hand-made jewellery, glass art, screen printing, sculptures, hand thrown ceramics, wood-turning, rag rugs, lampshades, etc.

Events.description:
Thank you for clicking on our event.
We are the Portsmouth, UK Toastmasters Club 'Spinnaker Speakers'.
We are a welcoming, friendly and supportive group of people who are all passionate about improving our speaking skills and helping others to achieve their goals.
We currently meet twice a month - 2nd & 4th Monday (no meetings on Bank Holidays) - in Portsmouth Opposite the Hard Interchange.
You are warmly invited to come along to one of our meetings as a guest, for free, regardless of your current ability level, to see what we are about and find out how you can build your confidence through learning and developing the following skills:
- Public Speaking
- Presentation
- Leadership
Our club is part of the worldwide Toastmasters International organisation that has been helping people learn to be more confident speakers for over 90 years.
Each meeting is fun, engaging and interesting, with Guests always being offered the opportunity, along with our Members, to participate in our impromptu speaking session - 'Table Topics'.
Anyone over the age of 18 is welcome. We have a diverse and open-minded paid membership from all walks of life and Toastmasters has changed many people's lives. Will yours be next?
Please feel free to contact us for more details without any pressure or obligation.
We understand that many people who first contact us are nervous, so please know that you will always receive a warm welcome both before and at our meetings.

Events.location: Keppel's Head Hotel, 24-26 The Hard, Portsmouth

Events.summary: Discuss around the world in 80 days by Jules Verne
Events.description:
'Phileas Fogg was one of those mathematically exact people, who, never hurried and always ready, are economical of their steps and their motions. He never made one stride too many, always going by the shortest route. He did not give an idle look. He did not allow himself a superfluous gesture.'
When Phileas Fogg wagers a bet that he can travel across the globe in just 80 days, little does he know about the epic journey that he is about to undertake. With his faithful French servant, Passepartout, Phileas Fogg embarks on the adventure of a lifetime, travelling across four continents by whatever means he can ‚Äì train, elephant, steam ship ‚Äì and experiencing endless surprises and mishaps along the way.

Events.summary: GoodGym Portsmouth // Group Session // Do Good & Get Fit
Events.description:
PLEASE VISIT THE WEBSITE TO CONFIRM SESSION DETAILS AND LET US KNOW YOU PLAN TO ATTEND. THIS IS MANDATORY.
Want to do something useful with your exercise? GoodGym is no ordinary gym. We're a group of people who get fit by doing good - helping out local charities and community groups with physical jobs like shifting compost and planting trees.
üìç We meet at Morrison's supermarket, Anchorage Road, Portsmouth, PO3 5UH at 6:00pm.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è At 6:15pm we'll run, walk or cycle to do a 30-40 minute task.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Then we'll head back to where we started by 7:45pm, do some stretches and maybe grab a beverage?
It's FREE. It's fun. It's fulfilling. And we're a very friendly bunch. üçá
‚Äî
BOOK ONTO THE SESSION
To come to the session click here: https://www.goodgym.org/areas/portsmouth/happenings
You will need to confirm your attendance on the GoodGym website (this includes creating an account with us if you haven‚Äôt already - it only takes a few mins).
The link above takes you to the session listings in your area - if this session doesn‚Äôt fit your schedule, you may find something that does so check it out.
p.s. GoodGym is a charity and you will be asked whether you‚Äôd like to donate when first creating an account. The choice is yours and does not affect your ability to attend a session.
‚Äî
FAQ
Not sure you'll keep up? GoodGym is for everyone (18+). Whether you've never run before, or are chasing a marathon PB, you are 100% welcome. We always have a back-marker so no one gets left behind.
70% of GoodGym members start as non-runners so if you're new to this kind of thing you will be supported by people who are all on the same journey. üëç
What do I need to wear? Most of us wear gym/running gear. Make sure you're prepared for the weather.
Don't feel like you're fit enough? Our tasks are simple and fun. There are easy jobs as well as more challenging things for those who want a workout! The choice is always yours.
Do I need to bring anything? Gardening gloves are really useful for a lot of GoodGym tasks. And a head torch too if it‚Äôs likely to get dark. Please bring some if you can but there‚Äôs no requirement üß§üí°üß§
What is GoodGym? We're a (really lovely) group of people who use our energy to make a difference in our local community (and in communities across the UK!). We often meet on a weeknight, at least once a week, for a session to do good and get fit. We'd love you to come and join us. Any questions, just pop a comment below or send me a message. Find out everything you need to know at goodgym.org

Events.description:
Thank you for clicking on our event.
We are the Portsmouth, UK Toastmasters Club 'Spinnaker Speakers'.
We are a welcoming, friendly and supportive group of people who are all passionate about improving our speaking skills and helping others to achieve their goals.
We currently meet twice a month - 2nd & 4th Monday (no meetings on Bank Holidays) - in Portsmouth Opposite the Hard Interchange.
You are warmly invited to come along to one of our meetings as a guest, for free, regardless of your current ability level, to see what we are about and find out how you can build your confidence through learning and developing the following skills:
- Public Speaking
- Presentation
- Leadership
Our club is part of the worldwide Toastmasters International organisation that has been helping people learn to be more confident speakers for over 90 years.
Each meeting is fun, engaging and interesting, with Guests always being offered the opportunity, along with our Members, to participate in our impromptu speaking session - 'Table Topics'.
Anyone over the age of 18 is welcome. We have a diverse and open-minded paid membership from all walks of life and Toastmasters has changed many people's lives. Will yours be next?
Please feel free to contact us for more details without any pressure or obligation.
We understand that many people who first contact us are nervous, so please know that you will always receive a warm welcome both before and at our meetings.

We have had a cracking last few meetups and this one is going to be no exception!
Celebrate with a beer and some fun tunes. It doesn't matter what standard you are - everything we play can be played by anyone with a basic ability for chords!
We have a few song books so we can also play some old classics!
We'll tune up, assess standards and then start playing.
These days we are starting with a 12 bar blues jam (in A Major usually) which gets us going and allow everyone to find their feet. We have been building a playlist and so far it includes things like:

Sunny Afternoon - Kinks
A Santana style jam
Hotel California
Wish You Were Here
Saw Her Standing There - Beatles
After Midnight - JJ Cale
Maggie May - Rod Stewart
Handbags and Gladrags
Folsom Prison Blues - Johnny Cash
Into the Mystic - Van Morrison
The Chain - Fleetwood Mac
The Man who Sold the World - Bowie

Full list is here
If there is something you want to play then we'll have a crack at that too - we always like to try something new - and suggestions have been as diverse as Dolly Parton (Jolene) and George Michael - and all were a blast!
The Dolphin is a nice pub in Old Portsmouth - it serves food and some nice beers. We will be in the upstairs room.
The more the merrier - so come along whatever your standard (I am distinctly intermediate!) - we play songs that pretty much anyone can play.
If you use Ultimate Guitar Tabs you can also see the tabs we are playing HERE.
If you can, bring a tablet/phone/laptop to bring tabs up on.
Most importantly, bring a couple of songs that you want to play!
We look forward to welcoming you!

Events.description:
In the house of Helios, god of the sun and mightiest of the Titans, a daughter is born. Circe is a strange child - not powerful and terrible, like her father, nor gorgeous and mercenary like her mother. Scorned and rejected, Circe grows up in the shadows, at home in neither the world of gods or mortals. But Circe has a dark power of her own: witchcraft. When her gift threatens the gods, she is banished to the island of Aiaia where she hones her occult craft, casting spells, gathering strange herbs and taming wild beasts. Yet a woman who stands alone will never be left in peace for long - and among her island's guests is an unexpected visitor: the mortal Odysseus, for whom Circe will risk everything.

Events.description:
Metropolitan Walkers is part of the Ramblers, Britain's walking charity. All welcome for 3 'taster' walks, after which please join the Ramblers - info on the Met Walkers website
An undulating walk heading due north from Rowlands Castle, hopefully offering wide expansive views across the rolling East Hampshire and West Sussex countryside. High points featured include Chalton Down, Windmill Hill, and Hampshire's highest point: Butser Hill, before we wend our way into the market town of Petersfield. (540m total ascent).
Please bring a packed lunch. Caf√© stop at lunchtime (for drinks and cake only), with a pub at the end. (Marked as strenuous for ascent, rather than speed or distance).
Terrain: Fields, Woods, Chalk Paths, Country Roads
Travel: Take 8:45 from London Waterloo (8:52 Clapham Junction), arr. Rowlands Castle 10:23 (front 6 carriages only).
Buy return to Rowlands Castle.
Grading: Strenuous.
For an explanation of the gradings, please see the FAQ - please consider both the length and grade when choosing a walk.
Finish point: Petersfield station
More info: https://www.ramblers.org.uk/go-walking/group-walks/hills-hampshire

Come and join us as we bring out our inner laughter together. This is a friendly and welcoming group, where laughter is the name of the game. No experience necessary.
At a laughter club, we'll be invited to join in with some light-hearted games, activities and meditations that encourage natural laughter and playfulness. You'll feel energised and invigorated, and can share conversation over a drink afterwards with your fellow laughers.
The club is open to all adults who have a willingness to try something new and fun. The proven benefits of laughter yoga include mood elevation, stress reduction, increased energy, emotional balance and increased immunity. Deep belly laughing is also great exercise.
The Serenity Complementary Centre is an ideal venue, with free parking in the small car park and on-street. Wear normal, comfortable clothing and expect serious fun.
Sessions are ¬£7 including refreshments. Come and connect with others as we experience the benefits of real laughter together.

Events.summary: GoodGym Portsmouth // Group Session // Do Good & Get Fit
Events.description:
PLEASE VISIT THE WEBSITE TO CONFIRM SESSION DETAILS AND LET US KNOW YOU PLAN TO ATTEND. THIS IS MANDATORY.
Want to do something useful with your exercise? GoodGym is no ordinary gym. We're a group of people who get fit by doing good - helping out local charities and community groups with physical jobs like shifting compost and planting trees.
üìç We meet at Morrison's supermarket, Anchorage Road, Portsmouth, PO3 5UH at 6:00pm.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è At 6:15pm we'll run, walk or cycle to do a 30-40 minute task.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Then we'll head back to where we started by 7:45pm, do some stretches and maybe grab a beverage?
It's FREE. It's fun. It's fulfilling. And we're a very friendly bunch. üçá
‚Äî
BOOK ONTO THE SESSION
To come to the session click here: https://www.goodgym.org/areas/portsmouth/happenings
You will need to confirm your attendance on the GoodGym website (this includes creating an account with us if you haven‚Äôt already - it only takes a few mins).
The link above takes you to the session listings in your area - if this session doesn‚Äôt fit your schedule, you may find something that does so check it out.
p.s. GoodGym is a charity and you will be asked whether you‚Äôd like to donate when first creating an account. The choice is yours and does not affect your ability to attend a session.
‚Äî
FAQ
Not sure you'll keep up? GoodGym is for everyone (18+). Whether you've never run before, or are chasing a marathon PB, you are 100% welcome. We always have a back-marker so no one gets left behind.
70% of GoodGym members start as non-runners so if you're new to this kind of thing you will be supported by people who are all on the same journey. üëç
What do I need to wear? Most of us wear gym/running gear. Make sure you're prepared for the weather.
Don't feel like you're fit enough? Our tasks are simple and fun. There are easy jobs as well as more challenging things for those who want a workout! The choice is always yours.
Do I need to bring anything? Gardening gloves are really useful for a lot of GoodGym tasks. And a head torch too if it‚Äôs likely to get dark. Please bring some if you can but there‚Äôs no requirement üß§üí°üß§
What is GoodGym? We're a (really lovely) group of people who use our energy to make a difference in our local community (and in communities across the UK!). We often meet on a weeknight, at least once a week, for a session to do good and get fit. We'd love you to come and join us. Any questions, just pop a comment below or send me a message. Find out everything you need to know at goodgym.org

Explore lens-free photography with this environmentally friendly 19th century blue print technique. I will take you through process of making cyanotypes allowing you plenty of time to experiment. Events.summary: IN PERSON - The Art of Happiness: Finding Inner Peace Amidst the Chaos
Events.description:
In today‚Äôs busy and stimulus-driven world, many are realising that happiness gained through material wealth & development of our physical world is short-lived. We jump from one desire to the next, one job, partner, home, car to the next, but find we‚Äôre still unsatisfied. While modern science and material development can alleviate physical ailments, it will never be able to cure an unhappy and unbalanced mind.
During this evening talk, held at Meon Valley Hotel in Southampton, we will explore a different approach ‚Äì simple yet effective techniques from the Buddhist tradition for finding calm, focus, and a sense of wellbeing amidst everyday challenges and change.
With time and practice, we can regain control of our minds, helping us to manage life‚Äôs stresses and handle challenges effectively. This helps us be at peace with ourselves and our surroundings, and find a different kind of happiness ‚Äì one that is not dependent on having the perfect external circumstances.
Following this talk, on Saturday, 29th June, we will be hosting a day retreat called ‚ÄòTransforming Your Mind: An Introduction to Buddhist Mind Training‚Äò which offers us a chance to explore in more depth, We‚Äôd be delighted to see you for both events to make the most of this time together.
If you require accommodation, the Meon Valley Hotel & Country Club has overnight rooms available which you can enquire about through their website. The 225-acre property features a golf course, and on-site facilities including a fully equipped gym, heated pool, and spa facilities.
####
What We'll Cover

Explore meditation techniques for relaxation and stress release.
Learn how meditation can help us to manage life‚Äôs stress and daily challenges.
Experience stillness and calm through easy-to-follow guided meditations.
An opportunity to ask questions, and share and learn with like-minded friends.

Booking & Donations
There are limited places available for this evening talk. Please book in advance using the form on our website.
We are embracing a sliding scale policy for this event, guided by the Buddhist principle of generosity and inclusivity. There are suggested donations to help cover the cost of putting on this talk and the following day retreat, including room hires, lunch, teas & coffees, and the travel and accommodation cost for the teacher and volunteers.
Choosing the higher option includes a donation to support our activities for the benefit of all.
Option 1 - Cover Our Running Costs + Donation - ¬£15
Option 2 - Cover Our Running Costs - ¬£10
Option 3 - Low Waged - ¬£6
Option 4 - Donation of Your Choosing
We firmly believe, however, that financial constraints should never be a barrier to participation. If the suggested amount is beyond your means, please choose the lower option or contribute what you can ‚Äî every offering helps make this event possible for the collective good. Without your honesty and generosity, we wouldn‚Äôt be able to make this event happen!
Event Last Updated: 2024-06-28T00:00:22.665Z
Events.location: Meon Valley Hotel, Golf & Country Club, Sandy Lane, Southampton

Events.summary: GoodGym Portsmouth // Group Session // Do Good & Get Fit
Events.description:
PLEASE VISIT THE WEBSITE TO CONFIRM SESSION DETAILS AND LET US KNOW YOU PLAN TO ATTEND. THIS IS MANDATORY.
Want to do something useful with your exercise? GoodGym is no ordinary gym. We're a group of people who get fit by doing good - helping out local charities and community groups with physical jobs like shifting compost and planting trees.
üìç We meet at Morrison's supermarket, Anchorage Road, Portsmouth, PO3 5UH at 6:00pm.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è At 6:15pm we'll run, walk or cycle to do a 30-40 minute task.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Then we'll head back to where we started by 7:45pm, do some stretches and maybe grab a beverage?
It's FREE. It's fun. It's fulfilling. And we're a very friendly bunch. üçá
‚Äî
BOOK ONTO THE SESSION
To come to the session click here: https://www.goodgym.org/areas/portsmouth/happenings
You will need to confirm your attendance on the GoodGym website (this includes creating an account with us if you haven‚Äôt already - it only takes a few mins).
The link above takes you to the session listings in your area - if this session doesn‚Äôt fit your schedule, you may find something that does so check it out.
p.s. GoodGym is a charity and you will be asked whether you‚Äôd like to donate when first creating an account. The choice is yours and does not affect your ability to attend a session.
‚Äî
FAQ
Not sure you'll keep up? GoodGym is for everyone (18+). Whether you've never run before, or are chasing a marathon PB, you are 100% welcome. We always have a back-marker so no one gets left behind.
70% of GoodGym members start as non-runners so if you're new to this kind of thing you will be supported by people who are all on the same journey. üëç
What do I need to wear? Most of us wear gym/running gear. Make sure you're prepared for the weather.
Don't feel like you're fit enough? Our tasks are simple and fun. There are easy jobs as well as more challenging things for those who want a workout! The choice is always yours.
Do I need to bring anything? Gardening gloves are really useful for a lot of GoodGym tasks. And a head torch too if it‚Äôs likely to get dark. Please bring some if you can but there‚Äôs no requirement üß§üí°üß§
What is GoodGym? We're a (really lovely) group of people who use our energy to make a difference in our local community (and in communities across the UK!). We often meet on a weeknight, at least once a week, for a session to do good and get fit. We'd love you to come and join us. Any questions, just pop a comment below or send me a message. Find out everything you need to know at goodgym.org

Events.description:
Come and jam with us on the evening of Tuesday 16th July. We have had a cracking last few meetups and this one is going to be no exception!
Celebrate the joy of playing music together with a beer and some fun tunes. It doesn't matter what standard you are - everything we play can be played by anyone with a basic ability for chords! If you can't play guitar but you can sing (or play bass or percussion) then come along too - we always need singers!
We'll tune up, assess standards and then start playing - everyone gets to choose at least 1 song. We have been building a playlist and so far it includes things like:

Sunny Afternoon - Kinks
Hotel California
Wish You Were Here
Saw Her Standing There - Beatles
After Midnight - JJ Cale
Maggie May - Rod Stewart
Handbags and Gladrags - Rod Stewart/Stereophonics
Folsom Prison Blues - Johnny Cash
Into the Mystic - Van Morrison
The Chain - Fleetwood Mac
The Man Who Sold the World - Bowie

Full list is here
If there is something you want to play then we'll have a crack at that too - we always like to try something new - and suggestions have been as diverse as Dolly Parton (Jolene) and George Michael - and all were a blast! The only warning is that if the song is particularly obscure then you may need to lead the singing too!
We will be at the Barley Mow pub in Southsea.
The more the merrier - so come along whatever your standard (I am distinctly intermediate!) - we play songs that pretty much anyone can play.
If you use Ultimate Guitar Tabs you can also see the tabs we are playing HERE.
If you can, bring a tablet/phone/laptop to bring tabs up on.
Most importantly, bring a couple of songs that you want us to play!

Events.description:
Online webinar hosted by the IoD with co-sponsors Hampshire Chamber of Commerce and Federation of Small Businesses.


¬†
The importance of embedding ‚ÄòSocial Value‚Äô into your company to benefit staff, the wider community, and the bottom line.

'Social Value' - would you like to know more? The term is becoming more readily used but not everyone understands the main ways it can be embedded in their company to benefit staff, the wider community, and the increase the bottom line.

Does your company tender for Local Authority / government contracts? Are you looking to expand into this arena or¬†form part of a supply chain? ¬†If so,¬†this Act will particularly affect your company.¬† The new 'Public Procurement 2023 Act' will transform the government's procurement process, levelling-up the business playing field by giving all Social Value Ready SMEs access to tender for ¬£100 billion of government contracts. The degree to which a business embraces this new law will directly impact their capacity to thrive and grow. Think of it as the new ISO 9001.

By the end of the talk, you will:


	Have a clear understanding of the impact that social value and wellbeing, and the new Public Procurement Act will have on your business, and the UK and global business landscape.
	Appreciate potential opportunities, and risks, to your business's health and growth.
	Understand the 8 key areas a company will be judged upon in terms of a Social Value Policy and embedded Social Value Strategy.


Attendees will be entitled to free membership of the SVRE SME Business Hub for social value guidance, support and governmental framework updates, along with possible collaborations with other SVRE SMEs to bid for contracts.¬†

Attendees will also be entitled to take the free SVRE Ready self-assessment giving you a complimentary one hour 1-to-1 consultation to explore your results.¬†

Speakers


David Riley - CEO of SVRE UK Limited, and Social Value lead

David has worked extensively within government since 1996, specialising in strategic change, and creating bid tenders. He guides leadership teams in adapting to complex new government policies, including the Social Value Act 2012, and the Procurement Act 2023, and making the changes they need in their businesses.¬†

Events.summary: QNUK Level 2 Award in Mental Health at Work
Events.description:
Access to effective, topical, and thematic training, that ensures externally accredited compliance, is at the heart of developing good business practice.

Responding to feedback from members, the Chamber has partnered with Good Skills Training Ltd to deliver a suite of workplace compliance courses. Supported by BizSpace, this partnership will help ensure that employers in our network with more than 5 staff can fulfil their legal obligations while businesses of any kind are supported to create a safe and accessible workplace environment.



QNUK Level 2 Award in Mental Health at Work

With an increase in poor mental health, it is important that individuals understand their own mental health and how common mental health concerns can be identified in themselves and others, with strategies to reduce the risk.

The QNUK Level 2 Award in Mental Health at Work is the ideal introduction to understanding mental health in the workplace. The qualification covers the most common mental health conditions, how to identify potential mental health concerns in colleagues and then how to discuss their needs and assist them to access suitable services and support.

Good Skills Training are experts at delivering the QNUK Level 2 Award in Mental Health at Work in an enjoyable and interactive way.

Who is the Course For?

	Anyone with an interest in¬†mental health at work
	Anyone with an interest in their own mental health

Course Syllabus:


	Be aware of common mental health disorders
	Know how to recognise the causes and impact of stress
	Know how to recognise the causes and impact of common mental health conditions
	Understand how individuals may use harmful strategies to cope with a mental health disorder
	Know how to support an individual with a mental health issue

Prerequisites:
This qualification is available to those over 18 years. Due to the language of the assessment, it is recommended that learners have enough command of the English language in order to understand the assessment and to undertake the recommended assessment methods.¬†

Awarding Body:
OFQUAL regulated qualification through Qualifications Network (QNUK)¬†¬†

Assessment Method:
The QNUK Level 2 Award in Mental Health at Work is assessed by written multiple choice assessment

Refreshments and Lunch will be provided -¬†If you have a dietary requirement, please let us know by using the 'Special Request' box, indicated with a speech bubble icon, available after adding a ticket to your basket.

Good Skills Training Ltd.

https://goodskillstraining.co.uk/

Good Skills Training bring quality and affordable training and consultancy services to businesses, schools and individuals across Hampshire and the Isle of Wight.
They believe your compliance training should be fun and engaging as well as informative and relevant to your business.
¬†
They offer a full range of training, Health and Safety Services including generic Health and Safety courses, Risk Assessment Training, First Aid Training, COSHH and IOSH.
All courses meet the relevant guidelines for Health and Safety, First Aid and Safeguarding and are fully certificated.

Events.description:
Thank you for clicking on our event.
We are the Portsmouth, UK Toastmasters Club 'Spinnaker Speakers'.
We are a welcoming, friendly and supportive group of people who are all passionate about improving our speaking skills and helping others to achieve their goals.
We currently meet twice a month - 2nd & 4th Monday (no meetings on Bank Holidays) - in Portsmouth Opposite the Hard Interchange.
You are warmly invited to come along to one of our meetings as a guest, for free, regardless of your current ability level, to see what we are about and find out how you can build your confidence through learning and developing the following skills:
- Public Speaking
- Presentation
- Leadership
Our club is part of the worldwide Toastmasters International organisation that has been helping people learn to be more confident speakers for over 90 years.
Each meeting is fun, engaging and interesting, with Guests always being offered the opportunity, along with our Members, to participate in our impromptu speaking session - 'Table Topics'.
Anyone over the age of 18 is welcome. We have a diverse and open-minded paid membership from all walks of life and Toastmasters has changed many people's lives. Will yours be next?
Please feel free to contact us for more details without any pressure or obligation.
We understand that many people who first contact us are nervous, so please know that you will always receive a warm welcome both before and at our meetings.

Events.summary: Discuss Demon Copperhead by Barbara Kingsolver
Events.description:
Demon Copperhead is a once-in-a-generation novel that breaks and mends your heart in the way only the best fiction can.
Demon's story begins with his traumatic birth to a single mother in a single-wide trailer, looking 'like a little blue prizefighter.' For the life ahead of him he would need all of that fighting spirit, along with buckets of charm, a quick wit, and some unexpected talents, legal and otherwise.
In the southern Appalachian Mountains of Virginia, poverty isn't an idea, it's as natural as the grass grows. For a generation growing up in this world, at the heart of the modern opioid crisis, addiction isn't an abstraction, it's neighbours, parents, and friends. 'Family' could mean love, or reluctant foster care. For Demon, born on the wrong side of luck, the affection and safety he craves is as remote as the ocean he dreams of seeing one day. The wonder is in how far he's willing to travel to try and get there.
Suffused with truth, anger and compassion, Demon Copperhead is an epic tale of love, loss and everything in between.
Cost ¬£2 to cover meetup costs

Events.summary: Walk and Talk for cancer loss, Hampshire, Havant Coastal Walk, 11.8.24
Events.description:
On Sunday 11th August 2024 we will be hosting an informal walk and talk event around the Havant Coast.
This event is specifically for people who have lost a loved one to cancer. This event is for people aged 18 and over.
Where are we walking?
The walk will start in Havant and follow the Hayling Billy Trail south to Chichester Harbour. If the tide allows we will head along the beach to Warblington then return back. It will last approximately an hour.
Can anyone take part?
Our walk is open to any adult who has had a loved one die from cancer. The aim is to give you space to meet and talk with others who have experienced a similar loss, which our users tell us they find extremely helpful.
We will be limiting the number of walkers to 11 people so that we do not have too large a walking group. One of our volunteers will be hosting the event to walk and talk alongside you.
Please note that we do not allow guests unless you let us know in advance (as we are capping the number of attendees for each walk).
Pets and children are also not able to attend.
What are the timings for the day?
Walkers will be meeting at 10:00am and starting at 10:15am.
We aim to complete the walk, at approximately 11:15am.
Do I need to be a professional walker?
Definitely not. The event is about being together, spending time with others who have experienced similar things, and being outdoors. It‚Äôs not about being fit or racing.
How do I get involved?
To register for this event you will need to complete the registration form below:
https://survey.eu.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_81clzSq8zsAFFTU
Once completed you will receive an email confirming your place and with full details for the walk.
We are unable to respond to messages through MeetUp outside of office working hours. If you are having any difficulty with registering for the group, please email us at hello@thelossfoundation.org rather than through MeetUp and we will get back to you as soon as we can.
Please note that we are not a crisis service, so if you are in need of immediate support please do reach out to Samaritans who provide immediate listening support. They can be reached on 116 123.

Events.description:
How Speed Dating Works in Portsmouth
When you arrive at the Portsmouth venue you will be greeted by our friendly professional hosts. Once everyone has arrived and registered we will briefly explain the format of the evening. The ladies will then be asked to make their way to their allocated table. Once the ladies are seated the gentlemen will be asked to proceed to their first date.
You will have 4 minutes to chat to each date, once the 4 minutes is over we will ring a bell to indicate the time is up and for the gentlemen to move to their next date. Four minutes is long enough to see if you click with the person you are talking to and whether you would like to see them again and also short enough if you don't.
At the end of each date you have a brief few moments to make some notes on the person you have just dated. This is something to help jog your memory for the post event matching process the next day.
Half way through the event you will have an interval break so you can nip to the toilet or top up your drink.
Once all the dates are over you have the opportunity to stay on at the venue to mingle freely with others. Please remember to take your dating card home with you to assist you in entering in your ticks and potential matches.
Post Event
No later than 11am the following morning our matching system will be unlocked for you to enter your ticks from the previous evening. You have all day to tick as many people as you like from the night before. We guarantee you will find someone you will want to see again, otherwise we will give you your next Speed Dating event for free!
IMPORTANT: The number of attendees on MeetUp doesn`t reflect the real situation as we sell the majority of tickets on other platforms. Please bear this in mind. You can find more information here: https://bit.ly/3dm7Lju
Please note that our bookings team work standard UK business hours - if you book outside of these hours, your confirmation from Slowdating will be processed once the bookings team are in.

Events.description:
Aurora Gatherings are intended to provide safe spaces for exploring our personal awakenings and insights, thus allowing accelerated growth to take place.
Very often one person‚Äôs insight as to why their life is unfolding as it is, sparks another to see their life in a new light too.
To help us live in the magic of the moment, we tend to avoid getting absorbed in repeating second-hand knowledge, such as great books we have read or listened to wonderful teachers, etc.
No two meetings unfold in the same way.
Because there are no agenda‚Äôs, no set patterns in the meetings, we are giving the highest good full freedom to guide the gathering whenever we listen to our intuitions to guide our speech.
You are not expected to appear at each meeting because of some obligation. We would rather you go within to feel whether now is the right time to come to a meeting. This way, just the right people come for certain dynamics to unfold. Sometimes there are lots of people, sometimes just two or three.
If you would you like to explore participating in authentic conversation in your community, beyond beliefs, assumptions and agendas, please contact: Jeanine Hanneman (07769 666 729) for further details.
The Aurora Gathering meets in Jeanine's house near Emsworth.
The groups is a very friendly and welcoming one.
Refreshments provided and donations to the Aurora Gatherings are accepted.

Events.summary: GoodGym Portsmouth // Group Session // Do Good & Get Fit
Events.description:
PLEASE VISIT THE WEBSITE TO CONFIRM SESSION DETAILS AND LET US KNOW YOU PLAN TO ATTEND. THIS IS MANDATORY.
Want to do something useful with your exercise? GoodGym is no ordinary gym. We're a group of people who get fit by doing good - helping out local charities and community groups with physical jobs like shifting compost and planting trees.
üìç We meet at Morrison's supermarket, Anchorage Road, Portsmouth, PO3 5UH at 6:00pm.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è At 6:15pm we'll run, walk or cycle to do a 30-40 minute task.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Then we'll head back to where we started by 7:45pm, do some stretches and maybe grab a beverage?
It's FREE. It's fun. It's fulfilling. And we're a very friendly bunch. üçá
‚Äî
BOOK ONTO THE SESSION
To come to the session click here: https://www.goodgym.org/areas/portsmouth/happenings
You will need to confirm your attendance on the GoodGym website (this includes creating an account with us if you haven‚Äôt already - it only takes a few mins).
The link above takes you to the session listings in your area - if this session doesn‚Äôt fit your schedule, you may find something that does so check it out.
p.s. GoodGym is a charity and you will be asked whether you‚Äôd like to donate when first creating an account. The choice is yours and does not affect your ability to attend a session.
‚Äî
FAQ
Not sure you'll keep up? GoodGym is for everyone (18+). Whether you've never run before, or are chasing a marathon PB, you are 100% welcome. We always have a back-marker so no one gets left behind.
70% of GoodGym members start as non-runners so if you're new to this kind of thing you will be supported by people who are all on the same journey. üëç
What do I need to wear? Most of us wear gym/running gear. Make sure you're prepared for the weather.
Don't feel like you're fit enough? Our tasks are simple and fun. There are easy jobs as well as more challenging things for those who want a workout! The choice is always yours.
Do I need to bring anything? Gardening gloves are really useful for a lot of GoodGym tasks. And a head torch too if it‚Äôs likely to get dark. Please bring some if you can but there‚Äôs no requirement üß§üí°üß§
What is GoodGym? We're a (really lovely) group of people who use our energy to make a difference in our local community (and in communities across the UK!). We often meet on a weeknight, at least once a week, for a session to do good and get fit. We'd love you to come and join us. Any questions, just pop a comment below or send me a message. Find out everything you need to know at goodgym.org
