Events.summary: Science Discovery Group - Waste and Recycling with Trish Bailey
Events.description:
One with those with a fascination for the science of public services titled "Waste and Recycling". The talk is delivered by Trish Bailey, a volunteer Community Champion. to the Science Discovery Group in Emsworth near Portsmouth.
VENUE:
Meet in room Mountford 1, Emsworth Community Centre, Church Path, Emsworth PO10 7DP
ZOOM TICKETS:
The Zoom tickets for this talk are ¬£4.00 each and can be purchased at the following address:
https://www.simpletix.com/e/waste-and-recycling-tickets-184335
SUMMARY:
Our next meeting is September 16th on behalf of and with support from Hampshire County Council Waste and Resource Management Team, Trish Bailey, a volunteer Community Champion is joining us to discuss waste prevention. We will explore the waste hierarchy and how, although it is beneficial, recycling is a form of waste management and comes below waste prevention in the hierarchy.
There are more beneficial actions that can be taken such as reuse and repair. We will learn about how waste is managed in Hampshire and the materials that are currently recycled. We will also consider the importance of waste minimisation relating to food and textile waste, including tips to do this.
BUY TICKETS:
To attend a meeting on Zoom you will need to buy a ticket by clicking the link above. You will need to subscribe to the SDG email list to receive our emails. Subscribe by entering your details on our contact page.
‚Äã
When you buy a ticket you will get an email from orders@SimpleTix.com with your personal link to the Zoom meeting. If you do not see this email in your inbox please check your Spam/Junk folder. SimpleTix will also send you reminders for the meeting which also contain your meeting link. When the meeting starts simply click on the link in your email.
‚Äã
When you join the Zoom meeting you will be muted and unable to use your microphone, this is to avoid remote participant inadvertently interrupting the meeting. You will be able to see and hear the speaker and also see their slides. Please type any questions you might have into the chat.
Please note the charge is now ¬£4
We look forward to seeing you there but if you cannot make it, you can buy a ticket to listen on Zoom above.
Kevin and Annie
STANDARD STUFF:
All talks are open to the public.
Admission ¬£4 on the door
Some speakers have provided copies of their talks. These are shown on the 'Past Talks' page of the website
CONTACT US:
sciencediscoverygroup@gmail.com
www.sciencediscoverygroup.co.uk

Events.description:
Thank you for clicking on our event.
We are the Portsmouth, UK Toastmasters Club 'Spinnaker Speakers'.
We are a welcoming, friendly and supportive group of people who are all passionate about improving our speaking skills and helping others to achieve their goals.
We currently meet twice a month - 2nd & 4th Monday (no meetings on Bank Holidays) - in Portsmouth Opposite the Hard Interchange.
You are warmly invited to come along to one of our meetings as a guest, for free, regardless of your current ability level, to see what we are about and find out how you can build your confidence through learning and developing the following skills:
- Public Speaking
- Presentation
- Leadership
Our club is part of the worldwide Toastmasters International organisation that has been helping people learn to be more confident speakers for over 90 years.
Each meeting is fun, engaging and interesting, with Guests always being offered the opportunity, along with our Members, to participate in our impromptu speaking session - 'Table Topics'.
Anyone over the age of 18 is welcome. We have a diverse and open-minded paid membership from all walks of life and Toastmasters has changed many people's lives. Will yours be next?
Please feel free to contact us for more details without any pressure or obligation.
We understand that many people who first contact us are nervous, so please know that you will always receive a warm welcome both before and at our meetings.

Events.location: Keppel's Head Hotel, 24-26 The Hard, Portsmouth

Events.description:
Come and enjoy a night of Jammin' with us on the evening of Tuesday 3rd September.
We have had a cracking last few meetups and this one is going to be no exception!
Celebrate with a beer and some fun tunes. It doesn't matter what standard you are - everything we play can be played by anyone with a basic ability for chords! We always need someone who can sing too....
We have been building a playlist and so far it includes things like:

Sunny Afternoon - Kinks
Hotel California
Wish You Were Here
Saw Her Standing There - Beatles
After Midnight - JJ Cale
Maggie May - Rod Stewart
Handbags and Gladrags
Folsom Prison Blues - Johnny Cash
Into the Mystic - Van Morrison
The Chain - Fleetwood Mac
The Man who Sold the World - Bowie

Full list is here
If there is something you want to play then we'll have a crack at that too - we always like to try something new - and suggestions have been as diverse as Dolly Parton (Jolene) and George Michael - and all were a blast!
The Dolphin is a nice pub in Old Portsmouth - it serves food and some nice beers. We will be in the upstairs room.
The more the merrier - so come along whatever your standard (I am distinctly intermediate!) - we play songs that pretty much anyone can play.
If you use Ultimate Guitar Tabs you can also see the tabs we are playing HERE.
If you can, bring a tablet/phone/laptop to bring tabs up on.
Most importantly, bring a couple of songs that you want to play!
We look forward to welcoming you!

Events.summary: Science Discovery Group - Airbus: Space on your Doorstep
Events.description:
One with those with a fascination for space science titled "Airbus: Space on your Doorstep". The talk is delivered by Michael Bolt, a Principal Engineer at Airbus in Portsmouth to the Science Discovery Group in Emsworth near Portsmouth.
VENUE:
Meet in room Mountford 1, Emsworth Community Centre, Church Path, Emsworth PO10 7DP
ZOOM TICKETS:
The Zoom tickets for this talk are ¬£4.00 each and can be purchased at the following address:
https://www.simpletix.com/e/space-on-our-doorstep-tickets-175262
SUMMARY:
Our next meeting is July 15th when Michael Bolt will be talking to us about the UK space industry. Michael has extensive experience and will give us a review of its history with his personal perspectives and an emphasis on local contributions.
BUY TICKETS:
To attend a meeting on Zoom you will need to buy a ticket by clicking the link above. You will need to subscribe to the SDG email list to receive our emails. Subscribe by entering your details on our contact page.
‚Äã
When you buy a ticket you will get an email from orders@SimpleTix.com with your personal link to the Zoom meeting. If you do not see this email in your inbox please check your Spam/Junk folder. SimpleTix will also send you reminders for the meeting which also contain your meeting link. When the meeting starts simply click on the link in your email.
‚Äã
When you join the Zoom meeting you will be muted and unable to use your microphone, this is to avoid remote participant inadvertently interrupting the meeting. You will be able to see and hear the speaker and also see their slides. Please type any questions you might have into the chat.
Please note the charge is now ¬£4
We look forward to seeing you there but if you cannot make it, you can buy a ticket to listen on Zoom above.
Kevin and Annie
STANDARD STUFF:
All talks are open to the public.
Admission ¬£4 on the door
Some speakers have provided copies of their talks. These are shown on the 'Past Talks' page of the website
CONTACT US:
sciencediscoverygroup@gmail.com
www.sciencediscoverygroup.co.uk

Events.summary: GoodGym Portsmouth // Group Session // Do Good & Get Fit
Events.description:
PLEASE VISIT THE WEBSITE TO CONFIRM SESSION DETAILS AND LET US KNOW YOU PLAN TO ATTEND. THIS IS MANDATORY.
Want to do something useful with your exercise? GoodGym is no ordinary gym. We're a group of people who get fit by doing good - helping out local charities and community groups with physical jobs like shifting compost and planting trees.
üìç We meet at Morrison's supermarket, Anchorage Road, Portsmouth, PO3 5UH at 6:00pm.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è At 6:15pm we'll run, walk or cycle to do a 30-40 minute task.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Then we'll head back to where we started by 7:45pm, do some stretches and maybe grab a beverage?
It's FREE. It's fun. It's fulfilling. And we're a very friendly bunch. üçá
‚Äî
BOOK ONTO THE SESSION
To come to the session click here: https://www.goodgym.org/areas/portsmouth/happenings
You will need to confirm your attendance on the GoodGym website (this includes creating an account with us if you haven‚Äôt already - it only takes a few mins).
The link above takes you to the session listings in your area - if this session doesn‚Äôt fit your schedule, you may find something that does so check it out.
p.s. GoodGym is a charity and you will be asked whether you‚Äôd like to donate when first creating an account. The choice is yours and does not affect your ability to attend a session.
‚Äî
FAQ
Not sure you'll keep up? GoodGym is for everyone (18+). Whether you've never run before, or are chasing a marathon PB, you are 100% welcome. We always have a back-marker so no one gets left behind.
70% of GoodGym members start as non-runners so if you're new to this kind of thing you will be supported by people who are all on the same journey. üëç
What do I need to wear? Most of us wear gym/running gear. Make sure you're prepared for the weather.
Don't feel like you're fit enough? Our tasks are simple and fun. There are easy jobs as well as more challenging things for those who want a workout! The choice is always yours.
Do I need to bring anything? Gardening gloves are really useful for a lot of GoodGym tasks. And a head torch too if it‚Äôs likely to get dark. Please bring some if you can but there‚Äôs no requirement üß§üí°üß§
What is GoodGym? We're a (really lovely) group of people who use our energy to make a difference in our local community (and in communities across the UK!). We often meet on a weeknight, at least once a week, for a session to do good and get fit. We'd love you to come and join us. Any questions, just pop a comment below or send me a message. Find out everything you need to know at goodgym.org

Come and join us as we bring out our inner laughter together. This is a friendly and welcoming group, where laughter is the name of the game. No experience necessary.
At a laughter club, we'll be invited to join in with some light-hearted games, activities and meditations that encourage natural laughter and playfulness. You'll feel energised and invigorated, and can share conversation over a drink afterwards with your fellow laughers.
The club is open to all adults who have a willingness to try something new and fun. The proven benefits of laughter yoga include mood elevation, stress reduction, increased energy, emotional balance and increased immunity. Deep belly laughing is also great exercise.
The Serenity Complementary Centre is an ideal venue, with free parking in the small car park and on-street. Wear normal, comfortable clothing and expect serious fun.
Sessions are ¬£7 including refreshments. Come and connect with others as we experience the benefits of real laughter together.

At a laughter club, we'll be invited to join in with some light-hearted games, activities and meditations that encourage natural laughter and playfulness. You'll feel energised and invigorated, and can share conversation over a drink afterwards with your fellow laughers.
The club is open to all adults who have a willingness to try something new and fun. The proven benefits of laughter yoga include mood elevation, stress reduction, increased energy, emotional balance and increased immunity. Deep belly laughing is also great exercise.
The Serenity Complementary Centre is an ideal venue, with free parking in the small car park and on-street. Wear normal, comfortable clothing and expect serious fun.
Sessions are ¬£7 including refreshments. Come and connect with others as we experience the benefits of real laughter together.

Events.summary: Safe and Responsible Implementation of AI Systems
Events.description:
Join us at the stunning Plus X Innovation Workspace on Lewes Road, Brighton for our upcoming meetup where Daniel Hulme will journey through the challenges of implementing Artificial Intelligence systems and the likelihood of Dystopia vs Eutopia.
Our event will also allow our guests to interact with Daniel during the panel session and network with like-minded professionals engaging in discussions about the impact of AI on society.
Building on the themes of our previous successful events like "Harnessing AI For Good" and "May 2024 Meetup - Responsible AI & Microsoft", this meetup will provide insights into how AI is revolutionizing how we approach software development.
Whether you are an internet professional looking to stay ahead of the curve or simply curious about the potential of AI technology, this event is perfect for gaining new knowledge and expanding your network in the field of AI.
We plan to run from 6 - 8:30 pm, with structured content, then pass the baton to our guests for networking. Daniel will go live at 7:00pm.
Just before Daniel goes on, we will hear from Geoff Davies of Pivotal Edge AI, a leading AI consultancy dedicated to making advanced technology accessible and beneficial for everyone. Their mission is to demystify AI and empower individuals with the knowledge and tools to leverage AI in their daily lives.
Geoff will present Pivotal Edge AI's Everyday AI Academy Webinar, scheduled for Thursday 12th September 2024 at 6:30 pm.

Rules
Adults only, no more needs to be said.
There will be a charge for the monthly hall evening event of ¬£3, payment on arrival. the hall has a capacity of 90 so it's first come, first entry. Once capacity is reached we can not let others in, sorry. Capacity seems to be about 60, depending on how many seats around the tables.
You will be offered a loyalty card on arrival is you don't have one. stamp on an empty space and when you have 5 stamps, the 6th visit is free.
Bring some money (coins) for the above plus the opportunity to enter a raffle to win a game and you can buy drinks and snacks. also to buy any games that are being sold by others.
No alcohol. Soft drinks only. Guests found with alcohol will be politely asked to leave. Cans will be available to purchase on the night but feel free to bring your own should you wish. There will be FREE tea and coffee facilities available, bring your own mug!
Abusive and threatening behaviour will not be tolerated. Don't be a dick, you will be asked to leave.
Respect the property, this is a shared hall used by many groups. Treat it like you would your home (or if your home is a mess, my home). Tidy up after yourself and clean up if you make a mess.
Look after the games. People have spent their hard earned cash buying games that you may play. Be respectful of that.
No cheating.. no cards up sleeves, mirrors or any kind of 'Rain Man' activities please üòÅ
If you play a game and the group finish, pack it away before moving on to another...
What happens at the table stays at the table.. Yes someone might make a dick move or win hands down but remember it's just a game.. Tantrums such as throwing dice, game pieces, banging or kicking the table etc will not be tolerated and you may be asked to leave.

Events.description:
Thank you for clicking on our event.
We are the Portsmouth, UK Toastmasters Club 'Spinnaker Speakers'.
We are a welcoming, friendly and supportive group of people who are all passionate about improving our speaking skills and helping others to achieve their goals.
We currently meet twice a month - 2nd & 4th Monday (no meetings on Bank Holidays) - in Portsmouth Opposite the Hard Interchange.
You are warmly invited to come along to one of our meetings as a guest, for free, regardless of your current ability level, to see what we are about and find out how you can build your confidence through learning and developing the following skills:
- Public Speaking
- Presentation
- Leadership
Our club is part of the worldwide Toastmasters International organisation that has been helping people learn to be more confident speakers for over 90 years.
Each meeting is fun, engaging and interesting, with Guests always being offered the opportunity, along with our Members, to participate in our impromptu speaking session - 'Table Topics'.
Anyone over the age of 18 is welcome. We have a diverse and open-minded paid membership from all walks of life and Toastmasters has changed many people's lives. Will yours be next?
Please feel free to contact us for more details without any pressure or obligation.
We understand that many people who first contact us are nervous, so please know that you will always receive a warm welcome both before and at our meetings.

Events.summary: The Late September 2024 Portsmouth Guitar Jam
Events.description:
Come and jam with us on the evening of Tuesday 24th September. We have had a cracking last few meetups and this one is going to be no exception!
Celebrate the joy of playing music together with a beer and some fun tunes. It doesn't matter what standard you are - everything we play can be played by anyone with a basic ability for chords! If you can't play guitar but you can sing (or play bass or percussion) then come along too - we always need singers!
We'll tune up, assess standards and then start playing - everyone gets to choose at least 1 song. We have been building a playlist and so far it includes things like:

Sunny Afternoon - Kinks
Hotel California - Eagles
Wish You Were Here - Pink Floyd
Saw Her Standing There - Beatles
After Midnight - JJ Cale
Maggie May - Rod Stewart
Handbags and Gladrags - Rod Stewart/Stereophonics
Folsom Prison Blues - Johnny Cash
Into the Mystic - Van Morrison
The Chain - Fleetwood Mac
The Man Who Sold the World - Bowie

Full list is here
If there is something you want to play then we'll have a crack at that too - we always like to try something new - and suggestions have been as diverse as Dolly Parton (Jolene) and George Michael - and all were a blast! The only warning is that if the song is particularly obscure then you may need to lead the singing too!
We will be at the Barley Mow pub in Southsea.
The more the merrier - so come along whatever your standard (I am distinctly intermediate!) - we play songs that pretty much anyone can play.
If you use Ultimate Guitar Tabs you can also see the tabs we are playing HERE.
If you can, bring a tablet/phone/laptop to bring tabs up on.
Most importantly, bring a couple of songs that you want us to play!

Events.location: The Barley Mow, 39 Castle Road, Southsea

Events.summary: Southwick Park D-Day Circular Walk (5 miles)
Events.description:
A pleasant 5 mile countryside walk around the Southwick Park estate near Portsmouth, where D-Day was planned, in this special 80th anniversary year.
Meet up in the (free) public car park, behind the Golden Lion pub, where Churchill, General Eisenhower and Montgomery drank (grapefruit juice!)
Bring suitable walking boots and a picnic (as it's a Sunday and the pubs will be busy) and you can have it down by the Old Medieval Priory after the walk, or there is a Sandwich Tea Room opposite the pub.
Every year, Southwick hosts a 'D-Day Revival' with military vehicles and re-enactors, with no modern vehicles permitted into the village. It is a charming example of a 'Feudal Village', with some pretty thatched cottages, and still belongs to the 'Squire of Southwick'. Southwick Park still belongs to the MOD and is used for Police Training.
Event Last Updated: 2024-08-25T00:01:44.171Z
Events.location: Golden Lion Pub, High Street, Southwick PO17 6EB

Events.summary: GoodGym Portsmouth // Group Session // Do Good & Get Fit
Events.description:
PLEASE VISIT THE WEBSITE TO CONFIRM SESSION DETAILS AND LET US KNOW YOU PLAN TO ATTEND. THIS IS MANDATORY.
Want to do something useful with your exercise? GoodGym is no ordinary gym. We're a group of people who get fit by doing good - helping out local charities and community groups with physical jobs like shifting compost and planting trees.
üìç We meet at Morrison's supermarket, Anchorage Road, Portsmouth, PO3 5UH at 6:00pm.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è At 6:15pm we'll run, walk or cycle to do a 30-40 minute task.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Then we'll head back to where we started by 7:45pm, do some stretches and maybe grab a beverage?
It's FREE. It's fun. It's fulfilling. And we're a very friendly bunch. üçá
‚Äî
BOOK ONTO THE SESSION
To come to the session click here: https://www.goodgym.org/areas/portsmouth/happenings
You will need to confirm your attendance on the GoodGym website (this includes creating an account with us if you haven‚Äôt already - it only takes a few mins).
The link above takes you to the session listings in your area - if this session doesn‚Äôt fit your schedule, you may find something that does so check it out.
p.s. GoodGym is a charity and you will be asked whether you‚Äôd like to donate when first creating an account. The choice is yours and does not affect your ability to attend a session.
‚Äî
FAQ
Not sure you'll keep up? GoodGym is for everyone (18+). Whether you've never run before, or are chasing a marathon PB, you are 100% welcome. We always have a back-marker so no one gets left behind.
70% of GoodGym members start as non-runners so if you're new to this kind of thing you will be supported by people who are all on the same journey. üëç
What do I need to wear? Most of us wear gym/running gear. Make sure you're prepared for the weather.
Don't feel like you're fit enough? Our tasks are simple and fun. There are easy jobs as well as more challenging things for those who want a workout! The choice is always yours.
Do I need to bring anything? Gardening gloves are really useful for a lot of GoodGym tasks. And a head torch too if it‚Äôs likely to get dark. Please bring some if you can but there‚Äôs no requirement üß§üí°üß§
What is GoodGym? We're a (really lovely) group of people who use our energy to make a difference in our local community (and in communities across the UK!). We often meet on a weeknight, at least once a week, for a session to do good and get fit. We'd love you to come and join us. Any questions, just pop a comment below or send me a message. Find out everything you need to know at goodgym.org

Events.description:
Come and jam with us on the evening of Tuesday 20th August. We have had a cracking last few meetups and this one is going to be no exception!
Celebrate the joy of playing music together with a beer and some fun tunes. It doesn't matter what standard you are - everything we play can be played by anyone with a basic ability for chords! If you can't play guitar but you can sing (or play bass or percussion) then come along too - we always need singers!
We'll tune up, assess standards and then start playing - everyone gets to choose at least 1 song. We have been building a playlist and so far it includes things like:

Sunny Afternoon - Kinks
Hotel California
Wish You Were Here
Saw Her Standing There - Beatles
After Midnight - JJ Cale
Maggie May - Rod Stewart
Handbags and Gladrags - Rod Stewart/Stereophonics
Folsom Prison Blues - Johnny Cash
Into the Mystic - Van Morrison
The Chain - Fleetwood Mac
The Man Who Sold the World - Bowie

Full list is here
If there is something you want to play then we'll have a crack at that too - we always like to try something new - and suggestions have been as diverse as Dolly Parton (Jolene) and George Michael - and all were a blast! The only warning is that if the song is particularly obscure then you may need to lead the singing too!
We will be at the Barley Mow pub in Southsea.
The more the merrier - so come along whatever your standard (I am distinctly intermediate!) - we play songs that pretty much anyone can play.
If you use Ultimate Guitar Tabs you can also see the tabs we are playing HERE.
If you can, bring a tablet/phone/laptop to bring tabs up on.
Most importantly, bring a couple of songs that you want us to play!

Events.description:
Chamber Connects!¬†¬†

A collaborative networking event for the North of the county is brought to you in 2024 by Hampshire Chamber of Commerce.¬†Working in collaboration with Melanie Wardle from Marketing Motion (Coffee & Connect), Barbara Payne from Digital House (Connecting Biz) and Mark Jones from Destination Basingstoke, the whole event is led by Barry Smith from Hampshire Chamber of Commerce.¬†¬†


Open to all, and inclusive for members, Chamber Connects! gives you the fantastic opportunity to meet a variety of business professionals from across our PEER network who will come together regularly for a morning of facilitated networking. This collaborative approach is designed to ensure that the best connections are made and that all who attend can speak to the majority of those in the room.¬†¬†

What will you get from attending?¬†¬†

Engage with others in the Chamber‚Äôs PEER network through Facilitated Table Networking¬†¬†

The chance to spotlight your business, demonstrate your expertise and develop your reputation in your local business community.

Chamber Connects! will be held every 3rd Wednesday of the month from February ‚Äì December 2024 (and onwards!).¬†¬†

Future Chamber Connects! Events:¬†
Wednesday, 18th September - Audleys Wood Hotel
Wednesday 16th October - Andover College
Wednesday 20th November - Farnborough College of Technology
¬†

FREE Tea & Coffee will be available¬†¬†

We expect this to be a well-attended event, capped at 50 attendees - so book soon to avoid disappointment!¬†¬†

We look forward to seeing you there!¬†¬†

The Chamber Connects! Team¬†

Warbrook House Heritage Hotel


Hampshire‚Äôs Hidden Gem. Warbrook House is a magnificent Grade I listed mansion, set in 121 acres of Grade II listed gardens, complete with its very own Versailles-style canal and Waterloo bridge.

It makes the perfect location for conferences, weddings, private parties, team building, Christmas parties and a wide array of events both for business and pleasure.
It is conveniently located near the Berkshire-Hampshire border, close to Basingstoke, Reading, Heathrow Airport and Central London which is accessible by train.
It also makes a wonderful local escape for a relaxing retreat, a sumptuous afternoon tea or a special occasion dinner in The Clove Canal View Restaurant, an authentic Indian fine dining experience.

Events.summary: Walk Milton Common to Baffins Pond, Portsmouth
Events.description:
Did this walk and it was well received, especially St Cuthberts which is a lovely friendly community. Starting at the car park at the end of Locksway Road we will walk along the shore of Milton Common along to the People's Memorial, across to Tangiers Road and down to Baffins Pond. Walking approx half way round the pond, to detour a short distance to St Cuthbert's for a lunch, (sandwich/jkt potato} coffee/tea stop and returning past the rest of the pond back to Milton Common.
This is approx 3.5 - 4 miles on mostly flat surfaces of gravel path, road and grass.
Enter the carpark for the pub and go through as if toward the pub. Turn left behind the pub and drive into the car park. Free parking.
The number 13 bus goes to the end of Locksway Road.

Events.summary: Emergency First Aid at Work - One Day FAIB Accredited Course
Events.description:
Access to effective, topical, and thematic training, that ensures externally accredited compliance, is at the heart of developing good business practice.

Responding to feedback from members, the Chamber has partnered with Good Skills Training Ltd to deliver a suite of workplace compliance courses. Supported by Fareham College, this partnership will help ensure that employers in our network with more than 5 staff can fulfil their legal obligations while businesses of any kind are supported to create a safe and accessible workplace environment.¬†



Emergency First Aid at Work Course - One Day

Everyone should know a little first aid to be able to assist in an emergency. The Emergency First Aid at Work Course gives people the knowledge that could one day save a life.

Designed specifically with smaller low risk companies in mind, such as small offices, the Emergency First Aid at Work Course meets the legal obligations of these organisations to provide individuals to render first aid in an emergency.

This course is accredited by The First Aid Industry Body

Refreshments and Lunch will be provided -¬†If you have a dietary requirement, please let us know by using the 'Special Request' box, indicated with a speech bubble icon, available after adding a ticket to your basket.


Emergency First Aid at Work Course Syllabus

	Responsibilities of the Emergency First Aider
	Primary Assessment
	Secondary Assessment
	CPR & AED
	Seizures and Epilepsy
	Choking
	Shock and Bleeding
	Minor Injuries and Minor Burns
	Plus more

Emergency First Aid at Work Course Assessment Process

This course is assessed through a mixture of practical assessments and theoretical, multiple choice assessments.

Emergency First Aid at Work Course Renewal Process

It is strongly recommended that first aiders undergo an annual ¬Ω day First Aid Refresher Course to keep their skills up to date.

After three years‚Äô delegates must retake an Emergency First Aid at Work Course to keep their qualification valid.

Good Skills Training Ltd.

https://goodskillstraining.co.uk/

Good Skills Training bring quality and affordable training and consultancy services to businesses, schools and individuals across Hampshire and the Isle of Wight.
They believe your compliance training should be fun and engaging as well as informative and relevant to your business.
¬†
They offer a full range of training, Health and Safety Services including generic Health and Safety courses, Risk Assessment Training, First Aid Training, COSHH and IOSH.
All courses meet the relevant guidelines for Health and Safety, First Aid and Safeguarding and are fully certificated.

Events.summary: Demystifying DevOps : Enhancing culture, collaboration and growth - Michel Tome
Events.description:
PHP Hants is back!
Join us in this talk while we explore the evolving landscape of DevOps beyond its traditional role in automating deployments and managing infrastructure. As teams and organisations grow, so does the need for a DevOps culture that fosters collaboration, innovation and supports sustainable growth. We‚Äôll look at how the DevOps principles can be critical in transforming organisational culture, improve and enable cross-functional collaboration, and pioneering continuous improvement across the entire development lifecycle. This session will go through a journey of how DevOps principles can be extended to influence areas such as team dynamics, communication and feedback loops, security, integration, and much more. We will apply DevOps practices not just for operational efficiency, but as a catalyst for broader organisational change and long-term success.
Schedule:
6-7pm: Arrival, pizza, and chat time
7-8pm: Talk
8pm onwards: Optional socialising at the pub
You are welcome to arrive from 6pm when we will have pizza and time for socialising with fellow PHPers. The talk will start at 7pm and usually lasts til around 8pm. After the talk, we will head over to a local pub - all are welcome to join but no pressure if you want to head home afterwards instead!
***
Sponsors:
Spectrum IT - Spectrum IT Recruitment is a collaboration of over 15 years recruitment experience, providing recruitment services and consultancy to the IT sector UK wide.

Events.description:
Come and jam with us on the evening of Tuesday 10th September. We have had a cracking last few meetups and this one is going to be no exception!
Celebrate the joy of playing music together with a beer and some fun tunes. It doesn't matter what standard you are - everything we play can be played by anyone with a basic ability for chords! If you can't play guitar but you can sing (or play bass or percussion) then come along too - we always need singers!
We'll tune up, assess standards and then start playing - everyone gets to choose at least 1 song. We have been building a playlist and so far it includes things like:

Sunny Afternoon - Kinks
Hotel California - Eagles
Wish You Were Here - Pink Floyd
Saw Her Standing There - Beatles
After Midnight - JJ Cale
Maggie May - Rod Stewart
Handbags and Gladrags - Rod Stewart/Stereophonics
Folsom Prison Blues - Johnny Cash
Into the Mystic - Van Morrison
The Chain - Fleetwood Mac
The Man Who Sold the World - Bowie

Full list is here
If there is something you want to play then we'll have a crack at that too - we always like to try something new - and suggestions have been as diverse as Dolly Parton (Jolene) and George Michael - and all were a blast! The only warning is that if the song is particularly obscure then you may need to lead the singing too!
We will be at the Barley Mow pub in Southsea.
The more the merrier - so come along whatever your standard (I am distinctly intermediate!) - we play songs that pretty much anyone can play.
If you use Ultimate Guitar Tabs you can also see the tabs we are playing HERE.
If you can, bring a tablet/phone/laptop to bring tabs up on.
Most importantly, bring a couple of songs that you want us to play!

Events.description:
Thank you for clicking on our event.
We are the Portsmouth, UK Toastmasters Club 'Spinnaker Speakers'.
We are a welcoming, friendly and supportive group of people who are all passionate about improving our speaking skills and helping others to achieve their goals.
We currently meet twice a month - 2nd & 4th Monday (no meetings on Bank Holidays) - in Portsmouth Opposite the Hard Interchange.
You are warmly invited to come along to one of our meetings as a guest, for free, regardless of your current ability level, to see what we are about and find out how you can build your confidence through learning and developing the following skills:
- Public Speaking
- Presentation
- Leadership
Our club is part of the worldwide Toastmasters International organisation that has been helping people learn to be more confident speakers for over 90 years.
Each meeting is fun, engaging and interesting, with Guests always being offered the opportunity, along with our Members, to participate in our impromptu speaking session - 'Table Topics'.
Anyone over the age of 18 is welcome. We have a diverse and open-minded paid membership from all walks of life and Toastmasters has changed many people's lives. Will yours be next?
Please feel free to contact us for more details without any pressure or obligation.
We understand that many people who first contact us are nervous, so please know that you will always receive a warm welcome both before and at our meetings.

Events.summary: Chamber Connects! at Audleys Wood Hotel
Events.description:
Chamber Connects!¬†¬†

A collaborative networking event for the North of the county is brought to you in 2024 by Hampshire Chamber of Commerce.¬†Working in collaboration with Melanie Wardle from Marketing Motion (Coffee & Connect), Barbara Payne from Digital House (Connecting Biz) and Mark Jones from Destination Basingstoke, the whole event is led by Barry Smith from Hampshire Chamber of Commerce.¬†¬†


Open to all, and inclusive for members, Chamber Connects! gives you the fantastic opportunity to meet a variety of business professionals from across our PEER network who will come together regularly for a morning of facilitated networking. This collaborative approach is designed to ensure that the best connections are made and that all who attend can speak to the majority of those in the room.¬†¬†

What will you get from attending?¬†¬†

Engage with others in the Chamber‚Äôs PEER network through Facilitated Table Networking¬†¬†

The chance to spotlight your business, demonstrate your expertise and develop your reputation in your local business community.

You will have the chance to tour the Hotel with the General Manager, James Webb, and Mandy Walker National account manager.

Chamber Connects! will be held every 3rd Wednesday of the month from February ‚Äì December 2024 (and onwards!).¬†¬†

Future Chamber Connects! Events:¬†
Wednesday 16th October - Andover College
Wednesday 20th November - Farnborough College of Technology

FREE Tea & Coffee will be available¬†¬†

We expect this to be a well-attended event, capped at 50 attendees - so book soon to avoid disappointment!¬†¬†

We look forward to seeing you there!¬†¬†

The Chamber Connects! Team¬†






Audleys Wood is¬†a luxury country house hotel in Basingstoke, Hampshire. This captivating building, with an abundance of historic features, makes any stay special. From beautiful fireplaces to striking ceilings, there is something to discover around every corner.

Built in the 1880s as a private home for Thomas Pain, it subsequently enjoyed a rich and colourful history, with owners and visitors including the rich and famous. Today it is a much-loved 68 bedroom hotel surrounded by enchanting woodlands and seven acres of private grounds.¬†

Whether you are visiting for business or pleasure, Audleys Wood has so much to offer. It is the perfect venue for christenings, birthdays, anniversaries, engagements or a¬†romantic break¬†away with someone special. We're proud to be a¬†dog friendly hotel¬†so you can even share your experience with your canine companion if you choose.

The Garden Pavilion is a self-contained¬†wedding venue¬†and for¬†meetings¬†and conferences there are a whole host of options to suit your event requirements. Find us just 18 miles from Reading and 32 miles from Southampton, with easy access from the M3.

Whether you are seeking a countryside getaway with acres to explore and plenty of time to switch off, or a staycation filled with endless indulgence such as traditional afternoon tea, we invite you to make our house your home.

¬†

Events.summary: GoodGym Portsmouth // Group Session // Do Good & Get Fit
Events.description:
PLEASE VISIT THE WEBSITE TO CONFIRM SESSION DETAILS AND LET US KNOW YOU PLAN TO ATTEND. THIS IS MANDATORY.
Want to do something useful with your exercise? GoodGym is no ordinary gym. We're a group of people who get fit by doing good - helping out local charities and community groups with physical jobs like shifting compost and planting trees.
üìç We meet at Morrison's supermarket, Anchorage Road, Portsmouth, PO3 5UH at 6:00pm.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è At 6:15pm we'll run, walk or cycle to do a 30-40 minute task.
üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Then we'll head back to where we started by 7:45pm, do some stretches and maybe grab a beverage?
It's FREE. It's fun. It's fulfilling. And we're a very friendly bunch. üçá
‚Äî
BOOK ONTO THE SESSION
To come to the session click here: https://www.goodgym.org/areas/portsmouth/happenings
You will need to confirm your attendance on the GoodGym website (this includes creating an account with us if you haven‚Äôt already - it only takes a few mins).
The link above takes you to the session listings in your area - if this session doesn‚Äôt fit your schedule, you may find something that does so check it out.
p.s. GoodGym is a charity and you will be asked whether you‚Äôd like to donate when first creating an account. The choice is yours and does not affect your ability to attend a session.
‚Äî
FAQ
Not sure you'll keep up? GoodGym is for everyone (18+). Whether you've never run before, or are chasing a marathon PB, you are 100% welcome. We always have a back-marker so no one gets left behind.
70% of GoodGym members start as non-runners so if you're new to this kind of thing you will be supported by people who are all on the same journey. üëç
What do I need to wear? Most of us wear gym/running gear. Make sure you're prepared for the weather.
Don't feel like you're fit enough? Our tasks are simple and fun. There are easy jobs as well as more challenging things for those who want a workout! The choice is always yours.
Do I need to bring anything? Gardening gloves are really useful for a lot of GoodGym tasks. And a head torch too if it‚Äôs likely to get dark. Please bring some if you can but there‚Äôs no requirement üß§üí°üß§
What is GoodGym? We're a (really lovely) group of people who use our energy to make a difference in our local community (and in communities across the UK!). Events.summary: QNUK Level 2 Award in Mental Health at Work
Events.description:
Access to effective, topical, and thematic training, that ensures externally accredited compliance, is at the heart of developing good business practice.

Responding to feedback from members, the Chamber has partnered with Good Skills Training Ltd to deliver a suite of workplace compliance courses. Supported by Fareham College, this partnership will help ensure that employers in our network with more than 5 staff can fulfil their legal obligations while businesses of any kind are supported to create a safe and accessible workplace environment.



QNUK Level 2 Award in Mental Health at Work

With an increase in poor mental health, it is important that individuals understand their own mental health and how common mental health concerns can be identified in themselves and others, with strategies to reduce the risk.

The QNUK Level 2 Award in Mental Health at Work is the ideal introduction to understanding mental health in the workplace. The qualification covers the most common mental health conditions, how to identify potential mental health concerns in colleagues and then how to discuss their needs and assist them to access suitable services and support.

Good Skills Training are experts at delivering the QNUK Level 2 Award in Mental Health at Work in an enjoyable and interactive way.

Who is the Course For?

	Anyone with an interest in¬†mental health at work
	Anyone with an interest in their own mental health

Course Syllabus:


	Be aware of common mental health disorders
	Know how to recognise the causes and impact of stress
	Know how to recognise the causes and impact of common mental health conditions
	Understand how individuals may use harmful strategies to cope with a mental health disorder
	Know how to support an individual with a mental health issue

Prerequisites:
This qualification is available to those over 18 years. Due to the language of the assessment, it is recommended that learners have enough command of the English language in order to understand the assessment and to undertake the recommended assessment methods.¬†

Awarding Body:
OFQUAL regulated qualification through Qualifications Network (QNUK)¬†¬†

Assessment Method:
The QNUK Level 2 Award in Mental Health at Work is assessed by written multiple choice assessment

Refreshments and Lunch will be provided -¬†If you have a dietary requirement, please let us know by using the 'Special Request' box, indicated with a speech bubble icon, available after adding a ticket to your basket.

Good Skills Training Ltd.

https://goodskillstraining.co.uk/

Good Skills Training bring quality and affordable training and consultancy services to businesses, schools and individuals across Hampshire and the Isle of Wight.
They believe your compliance training should be fun and engaging as well as informative and relevant to your business.
¬†
They offer a full range of training, Health and Safety Services including generic Health and Safety courses, Risk Assessment Training, First Aid Training, COSHH and IOSH.
All courses meet the relevant guidelines for Health and Safety, First Aid and Safeguarding and are fully certificated.

Unlocking Hampshire‚Äôs Green Potential 2024

PEOPLE, PLANET, PROFIT

Building on the success of last years event, join us to better understand The Practical steps you can take to achieve your ESG goals.

Learn from first hand leading experts and education providers for those keen to champion greater sustainability and employ green values in their operations.
Unlocking Hampshire‚Äôs Green Potential offers a signature forum for those keen to champion greater sustainability and employ green values in their operations.

Hampshire Chamber of Commerce and Destination Basingstoke, supported by our sponsors Suez, Basingstoke and Deane and Trustmark, are pleased to be supporting one of the largest B2B environmental event in the South of England.


There will be guest speakers, exhibitors and, also this year‚Äôs focus will be on green skills with a panel of experts.

Hosted at the Apollo Hotel Basingstoke, from 09:00 on Thursday 7th November, this free event will offer first hand practical advice and presents a fantastic opportunity to meet like-minded businesses

At the heart of Unlocking Hampshire`s Green Potential are innovative local businesses making real change happen.

Our Sponsors:


Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council
Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council is dedicated to delivering high-quality services and facilities for residents and visitors and¬†supporting¬†the¬†sustainable and inclusive economic development of an area covering 245 square miles in north Hampshire.
With¬†over 7,000 businesses across its borough, the council provides comprehensive support to help companies¬†start, grow and relocate, regardless of size or ambition, while offering guidance on the journey to net zero. By sponsoring this event, the council underscores its commitment to protecting the planet and ensuring the¬†long-term success¬†of its thriving local business community that underpins the current and future prosperity of the borough.



SUEZ recycling and recovery UK
SUEZ recycling and recovery UK has a proud history of delivering award-winning environmentally responsible recycling and waste management solutions to 32,000 customers across the public and private sector. Operating in over 300 locations throughout the UK, from household waste recycling centres, transfer stations and landfills, to energy-from-waste facilities, SUEZ provides an extensive range of managed services. The company continues to pioneer innovative technologies for the UK‚Äôs circular economy and is building a sustainable future that doesn‚Äôt cost the earth. For more information, visit www.suez.co.uk.



TrustMark
TrustMark is the only UK Government-Endorsed Quality Scheme for work carried out in and around the home.¬†We are passionate about quality and assurance and what that means for homeowners and our Registered Businesses.
Since we started in 2005, we have been working to help drive-up standards across the industry and improve the protection offered to homeowners when having work done.¬†We‚Äôre a not-for-profit business which means we can focus on our customers ‚Äì homeowners and tradespeople ‚Äì and not on shareholders.
If you‚Äôre a homeowner we can help you find a tradesperson who is skilled, trained and competent to carry out the work you need.
If you‚Äôre a tradesperson looking to demonstrate your commitment to doing a great job with high levels of customer service, you can apply to join around 15,000 other TrustMark Registered Businesses.

Events.description:
Start time amended by popular request. Well the previous Thai buffet event went well so I propose an broader Asian cuisine followup. Yes there are a few Thai dishes but the emphasis is more on Japanese and Chinese (and the Peking duck plate is excellent). You can start with Chinese dim sums or Japanese sushi, decide on your main dishes then move on to a choice of desserts. I will book initially for 8 but can increase numbers if needed. It is a slightly earlier start as it is very popular. The restaurant is well served by buses (next to bus station) and train services (10 minute walk from station). Car parking is free after 6pm in the Market Quay car park just outside. I will arrive at 6:45pm to claim the seating and leave a message as to where we will be. You pay at the entrance (¬£22.95) plus a drink cost (cobra or asahi beers, excellent saki, soft drinks etc), and there is a water fountain. It closes at 10pm. The staff are mostly from Hong Kong so they know all about excellent buffet meals. Your arrival time can even be flexible so not problem if you come a bit late, that's the beauty of the setup - but we must know you are coming to keep your place available! Be careful re driving if you buy the saki... (Best to take the bottle home with you.)

Events.summary: Solent LSIP Health and Social Care Roundtable
Events.description:
Workforce supply challenges nationally and within the Solent are expected to continue as demand for health and social care services increases. Workforce growth has struggled to keep pace with rising demands over the past decade, due an ageing population and increasingly complex healthcare needs.

During our initial findings back in 2023, the Local Skills Improvement Plan recommended further research into this important sector, to better understand the local landscape, future skills gaps and recruitment challenges. LSIPs are an initiative that‚Äôs funded by the Department for Education (DfE) with the aim of putting employers at the heart of the skills agenda.

If you are a health and social care company or, stakeholder grappling with recruitment shortages, persistent skills challenges then we invite you to attend our forthcoming interactive roundtable discussion. This is an opportunity to share emerging trends, key insights and your in-depth knowledge, to help shape provision and support employer‚Äôs needs.

Please take this opportunity to contribute and benefit to the future of your sector!

Event Details:
Date:¬†Wednesday 13 November 2024
Time:¬† 9.30am - 11:30am
Location:¬†Eastleigh Holiday Inn - M3 JCT13, Leigh Road, Eastleigh, Hampshire, SO509PG¬†

Sign up now using our event link:¬†
If you have any questions or need more information, please contact us at: lsip@hampshirechamber.co.uk.

Local Skills Improvement Plans connect businesses with the education and training system to make sure our workforce is ready for the jobs of tomorrow. To learn more about the Solent LSIP and to read our most recent progress report please visit our LSIP homepage here; https://www.hampshirechamber.co.uk/lsip-new-main/hampshire-lsip-skills-channel/

Events.summary: South Coast Digital Marketing - 1 Year Celebration
Events.description:
South Coast Digital Marketing is turning 1!
That‚Äôs right ‚Äì it‚Äôs been a whole year since we launched SC Digital Marketing meetups, and what an amazing year it‚Äôs been!
To mark the occasion, we‚Äôre celebrating in style on Thurs 7th Nov, and we‚Äôd love for you to join us!
Come to Aspex Portsmouth, a stunning gallery space in Gunwharf Quays, for an evening filled with celebration. This event will be a bit different from our usual meetups. We‚Äôre hosting a lively panel debate, followed by an inspiring guest speaker, and then it‚Äôs time to network and party the night away!
And if you don‚Äôt want the evening to end, you can head out to one of Gunwharf Quays‚Äô many restaurants and bars for more fun!
There is an incredible night planned including:
‚úÖ Azahara Corrales, (Media Manager and brightonSEO Speaker), talking about how to Leverage AI for Marketing Success.
‚úÖ Fanni Meszaros from Pinterest, discussing how to Unlock New Growth Opportunities with Pinterest (and the imminent Black Friday events).
‚úÖ A panel debate involving Terence Carvalho from one of our sponsors at Delivered Social and Lee Bradshaw at boxChilli. They will be discussing:
"The Best Social Media Platforms for Business"
One thing that hasn‚Äôt changed ‚Äì this event is completely FREE! In fact, instead of charging for tickets, we‚Äôre donating the cost of your ticket to The Brain Tumour Charity, so by attending, you‚Äôre also making a difference.
What's more, we're also providing complimentary drinks and snacks for the evening!
Space is limited, so don‚Äôt miss out ‚Äì sign up now to secure your free ticket!
***
How to get there
Aspex Portsmouth is located in the characteristic Vulcan Building in Portsmouth‚Äôs Gunwharf Quays, next to the city‚Äôs waterfront.

Events.summary: PURE Networking at the MAST Mayflower Studios
Events.description:
Join businesses from all over the County as we visit the Mayflower MAST theatre, for a morning of facilitated networking.



Open to all, and inclusive for members, Pure Networking gives you the fantastic opportunity to meet a variety of business professionals from across our PEER network who come together regularly for an afternoon of facilitated networking. This collaborative approach is designed to ensure that the best connections are made and that all who attend can speak to the majority of those in the room.

What will you get from attending?

	Engage with others in the Chamber‚Äôs PEER network through Facilitated Networking
	Connect with those new to Chamber membership.
	The chance to spotlight your business, demonstrate your expertise, and develop your reputation in your local business community.
	Learn more about an interesting Hampshire location and business.
	Be among the first to hear the latest updates from your Chamber and its partner network.
	A speech from¬†Jill McDonagh, who will be speaking about Hampshire and Isle of Wight Air Ambulance

Refreshments will be provided -¬†If you have a dietary requirement, please let us know by using the 'Special Request' box, indicated with a speech bubble icon, available after adding a ticket to your basket.

Mayflower Theatre

They would also like to offer you 10% off venue hire to members and you will get to see all of these rooms when you come to the event.



When you come to our venues for your business meetings, events and conferencing, you‚Äôll not only be delighting your delegates, you‚Äôll also be helping to improve the lives of thousands of young people across Hampshire.

We‚Äôre flexible and have the resources to bring something different and often quite spectacular to the table. Why not add a touch of drama and entertainment to your quarterly team meetings, with an after-party to end a busy, productive day.

Click here for more details -¬†Mayflower for business | Mayflower

Events.summary: The Early December 2024 Portsmouth Guitar Jam
Events.description:
Come and jam with us on the evening of Tuesday 3rd December. We have had a cracking last few meetups and this one is going to be no exception!
Celebrate the joy of playing music together with a beer and some fun tunes. It doesn't matter what standard you are - everything we play can be played by anyone with a basic ability for chords! If you can't play guitar but you can sing (or play bass or percussion) then come along too - we always need singers!
We'll tune up, assess standards and then start playing - everyone gets to choose at least 1 song. We have been building a playlist and so far it includes things like:

Sunny Afternoon - Kinks
Hotel California - Eagles
Wish You Were Here - Pink Floyd
Saw Her Standing There - Beatles
After Midnight - JJ Cale
Maggie May - Rod Stewart
Handbags and Gladrags - Rod Stewart/Stereophonics
Folsom Prison Blues - Johnny Cash
Into the Mystic - Van Morrison
The Chain - Fleetwood Mac
The Man Who Sold the World - Bowie

Full list is here
If there is something you want to play then we'll have a crack at that too - we always like to try something new - and suggestions have been as diverse as Dolly Parton (Jolene) and George Michael - and all were a blast! The only warning is that if the song is particularly obscure then you may need to lead the singing too!
We will be at the Barley Mow pub in Southsea.
The more the merrier - so come along whatever your standard (I am distinctly intermediate!) - we play songs that pretty much anyone can play.
If you use Ultimate Guitar Tabs you can also see the tabs we are playing HERE.
If you can, bring a tablet/phone/laptop to bring tabs up on.
Most importantly, bring a couple of songs that you want us to play!
Event Last Updated: 2024-12-03T00:00:46.453Z
Events.location: The Barley Mow, 39 Castle Road, Southsea

Events.summary: Chamber of Solutions - Making a difference for the third sector
Events.description:
We are organising this special FREE Chamber of Solutions event putting a spotlight on building success in the charity and third sector.¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†¬†

¬†

Conditions are tough for all businesses, but for the third sector it is a particularly challenging time.

This Chamber of Solutions will explore ways to address reductions in regular donations, sporadic government funding, rising operational costs, increasing demand for services and ever-growing employment and skills needs. A perfect storm.¬†

The event is for those operating in the third sector, community organisations, businesses wanting to support charities, and stakeholder funders needing to address changing demands.

The panel will address a range of subjects giving insights from different perspectives. Through our usual collaborative approach in this Chamber of Solutions event we can help 3rd sector organisations and other businesses explore:
¬†

	Funding
	Operating Costs
	Legal Obligations
	Donors
	Demand for Services
	Building effective relationships


By attending this event you will be able to share your thoughts and ideas with the panel and other participants, inspiring each other towards building a stronger culture of community, giving, and cooperation.

This special event is brought to you in partnership with the Chamber‚Äôs ‚ÄòMeet the Charity‚Äô group reaching out across all parts of the third sector, including businesses supporting their goals.

Chairing the event is Rob Lewis of Mission Performance. He will be joined by a specialist panel:


	Jacqui Scott - Hampshire & Isle of Wight Community Foundation¬†
	Sandeep Sesodia - Parity Trust
	Joe Weston-McDowell - Motiv8
	Dawn Wood - Minstead Trust

Events.description:
How Speed Dating Works in Portsmouth
When you arrive at the Portsmouth venue you will be greeted by our friendly professional hosts. Once everyone has arrived and registered we will briefly explain the format of the evening. The ladies will then be asked to make their way to their allocated table. Once the ladies are seated the gentlemen will be asked to proceed to their first date.
You will have 4 minutes to chat to each date, once the 4 minutes is over we will ring a bell to indicate the time is up and for the gentlemen to move to their next date. Four minutes is long enough to see if you click with the person you are talking to and whether you would like to see them again and also short enough if you don't.
At the end of each date you have a brief few moments to make some notes on the person you have just dated. This is something to help jog your memory for the post event matching process the next day.
Half way through the event you will have an interval break so you can nip to the toilet or top up your drink.
Once all the dates are over you have the opportunity to stay on at the venue to mingle freely with others. Please remember to take your dating card home with you to assist you in entering in your ticks and potential matches.
Post Event
No later than 11am the following morning our matching system will be unlocked for you to enter your ticks from the previous evening. You have all day to tick as many people as you like from the night before. We guarantee you will find someone you will want to see again, otherwise we will give you your next Speed Dating event for free!
### Itinerary
19:00 Registration Starts
19:30 Speed Dating starts
20:15 Interval for drinks, mingling and relaxing!
20:30 Speed Dating continues
21:15/21:30 Speed Dating concludes, followed by optional post-event socializing
*Please note the times for the event interval and finish are approximates and will depend of the number of daters at the event.
IMPORTANT: The number of attendees on MeetUp doesn`t reflect the real situation as we sell the majority of tickets on other platforms. Please bear this in mind. You can find more information here: https://bit.ly/3dm7Lju
Please note that our bookings team work standard UK business hours - if you book outside of these hours, your confirmation from Slowdating will be processed once the bookings team are in.

Our recent LSIP Logistics Deep Dive, identifies that businesses are facing difficulties recruiting candidates with the technical, and specialist skills your business needs.
Many are reporting that they are finding it hard to attract new talent due to issues accommodating the demand for hybrid working, if this sounds familiar to your business we‚Äôd like to speak to you.

Hampshire Chamber of Commerce are hosting an interactive roundtable discussion focusing on the logistics sector. This employer engagement event supports our forthcoming publication of the Solent Logistics deep dive, and your in-depth knowledge, and key insights into the industry, are vital to help shape resources and support employers demands.

The study is targeted at businesses working within the sector to better understand the local landscape, future skills gaps, and recruitment challenges as part of the Solent Local Skills Improvement Plan. LSIPs are an initiative that‚Äôs funded by the Department for Education (DfE) with the aim of putting employers at the heart of the skills agenda. To learn more about the Solent LSIP and to read our most recent progress report please visit our LSIP homepage here;¬†Local Skills Improvement Plan | Hampshire Future Skills (hampshirechamber.co.uk).

Events.description:
Hampshire Chamber of Commerce is excited to launch the Sustainable Action Network, a peer-to-peer initiative designed to inspire and support each business involved to make three positive changes.

This inaugural roundtable session will explore the demand for such a network and, if supported, will collaboratively shape its structure to deliver real value. For example, one potential idea is forming a small subgroup dedicated to establishing Environment Champion Teams within businesses. This group would provide focused peer support while sharing valuable insights with the wider network.

What to expect:

	Peer-to-peer networking with 30 local businesses
	Share local examples of current and future responsible business practices. (Please let me know if you have an experience to talk about during the session)
	Help shape a Sustainable Action Network that serves local businesses


Whether you‚Äôre a member or non-member, we invite you‚Äîalong with your customers, suppliers, and partners‚Äîto join this Hampshire Chamber of Commerce-led Breakfast Roundtable. Together, let‚Äôs drive sustainable progress for businesses across the region.

Why FuturePlus? As sustainability experts with deep Hampshire roots (our co-founder Alex Smith is a Hampshire resident who has been part of the local green steering committee), we're partnering with the Chamber to provide sustainability support based on the practical implementation experiences we have working with organisations of all sizes, around the world, including Soho House and the England and Wales Cricket Board helping them build resilience through sustainability.

Events.summary: An Introduction to Redpanda Connect - Christopher Hoult
Events.description:
PHP Hants is back!
This month we will be joined by Christopher Hoult, who will be sharing his talk "An Introduction to Redpanda Connect"
Schedule:
6-7pm: Arrival, pizza, and chat time
7-8pm: An Introduction to Redpanda Connect - Christopher Hoult
8pm onwards: Optional socialising at the pub
As companies grow, they continue to produce and ingest more and more data in the form of events, instrumentation and logs, but all too often just collect it in a central data store for analysis after the fact - if at all. Frequently this requires long ETL processes, combining disparate data sets for context missing at run-time, and slow ad-hoc queries.
In this talk, I will give an introduction to Redpanda Connect - which promises "fancy stream processing made operationally mundane" - and present some effective, configuration-centric techniques to not only improve your real-time processing efforts, but to derive more business value from your data flows.
You are welcome to arrive from 6pm when we will have pizza and time for socialising with fellow PHPers. The talk will start at 7pm and usually lasts til around 8pm. After the talk, we will head over to a local pub - all are welcome to join but no pressure if you want to head home afterwards instead!
***
Sponsors:
Spectrum IT - Spectrum IT Recruitment is a collaboration of over 15 years recruitment experience, providing recruitment services and consultancy to the IT sector UK wide.

Events.description:
Hampshire Chamber of Commerce is delighted to invite its members to Lainston House Hotel near Winchester as its presents its achievement from the last 12 months.

In our 2024 annual meeting we will offer an overview of the Chambers strategic refresh, share our plans building on this for the next 12 months, present the accounts for the previous period, and elect board members for the following year.



Providing members with the chance to network with senior members of our board and strategy groups, as well as connect with other business leaders from across the county.

Our guest speaker: Howard Robson on behalf of Warner Goodman LLP. Howard will be talking about¬†Employment Law Changes, Employment Rights Bill, and Employment Practice.

Agenda -¬†https://www.hampshirechamber.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/Agenda-for-Hampshire-Chamber-of-Commerce-AGM-Thursday-31st-Oct-2024-2.pdf

Minutes of the previous AGM held on 18/10/23 -¬†https://www.hampshirechamber.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/Minutes-of-the-Hampshire-Chamber-of-Commerce-AGM-held-Wed-18-Oct-2023.pdf

2024 Proxy Form -¬†https://www.hampshirechamber.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/Form-of-Proxy-for-Hampshire-Chamber-AGM-Thursday-31-Oct-2024.docx

There is ample parking on site and Refreshments will be provided - If you have a dietary requirement, please let us know by using the 'Special Request' box, indicated with a speech bubble icon, available after adding a ticket to your basket.

Lainston House
¬†

Lainston House is a 17th century luxury hotel, offering luxurious stays, award-winning dining, bespoke meetings and memorable weddings. It is also home to the Season cookery school with award-winning chefs and renowned external experts.

Tucked away in¬†63 acres of rural Hampshire countryside, you can enjoy both a remote and relaxing escape in the country or a more activity filled getaway with lots to do on site, as well as so many attractions on your doorstep. Our luxurious and individually designed rooms and suites can be hard to tear yourself away from, but when you do you¬†can enjoy beautiful walks and bike rides in the grounds, inspiring cookery classes in Season and delicious dining in The Avenue or our brand new restaurant, The Wellhouse. Not to mention outstanding afternoon teas in the drawing room and casual dining in The Cedar Bar and on the sun-drenched terrace. Head out to explore local attractions, with the historic city of Winchester just 10 minutes drive, as well as the River Test, Bombay Sapphire distillery, Marwell Zoo and Paultons Park (and so much more) all within 15 miles.

Events.description:
Emerging trends from our recent LSIP Hospitality Deep Dive, identifies that businesses are struggling to find candidates with strong inter-personal skills.¬† The need for skills is greater than ever!¬†¬†¬†
¬†

People are essential to the success of hospitality businesses, and unfortunately, the entire sector has been struggling with worker shortages for a long time.

Join our interactive roundtable event to share the skills challenges your business is facing. We welcome your insights and knowledge¬†about the skills you need now and, in the future.¬†By getting involved your business can shape future skills agendas.¬†


Hampshire Chamber of Commerce‚Äôs focus through the Solent Local Skills Improvement Plan (LSIP) is to help bridge the gap between businesses and education, and we're looking to hear from local¬†Hospitality service providers.¬†Hampshire Chamber through the LSIP can help articulate to shape the skills provision across the area.

Event Details:
Date:¬†Wednesday 4 December 2024

Location: New Place Hotel, High Street, Shirrell Heath, Southampton, Hampshire, SO32 2JY

Click the link above to book your space today!

Local Skills Improvement Plans connect businesses with the education and training system to make sure our workforce is ready for the jobs of tomorrow. New Place Hotel

New Place is a stunning hotel and conference venue in Hampshire.

Ideally located for Southampton, Portsmouth, Winchester & Fareham it is a charming countryside setting with superb facilities making New Place Hotel perfect for an escape from your New Normal.

Ornate wrought-iron gates welcome you to a charming Hampshire venue ideally suited for meetings, events, weddings, and leisure breaks. New Place,¬† seamlessly blends traditional and modern spaces over 32 acres of landscaped gardens, including our Grade I listed manor house which houses a restaurant, a bar and meeting rooms.

Enjoy every modern convenience and amenity expected by today‚Äôs traveller, with all our bedrooms located in a delightful mews a short walk from the manor house and¬†set against a backdrop of ¬†relaxing English countryside. You‚Äôll have plenty to do during downtime with a gym, pool, croquet lawn, and cricket pitch on the property.

Events.description:
Access to effective, topical, and thematic training, that ensures externally accredited compliance, is at the heart of developing good business practice.

Responding to feedback from members, the Chamber has partnered with Good Skills Training Ltd to deliver a suite of workplace compliance courses. Supported by Fareham College, this partnership will help ensure that employers in our network with more than 5 staff can fulfil their legal obligations while businesses of any kind are supported to create a safe and accessible workplace environment.



Fire Marshall with Practical Extinguisher - Half Day Course

It is a requirement under the Regulatory Reform Order 2005 that all organisations appoint sufficient Fire Marshal‚Äôs to cover the day to day responsibilities for fire safety and training in these responsibilities.

Good Skills Training aim that all learners should enjoy their Fire Marshall Course and that by the end of their course all delegates should be confidently aware of their legal duties about fire safety and be aware of what to do in the event of a fire in their organisation.

Fire Marshall Course Syllabus

	Legislation
	Causes of fire and how fire spreads
	Classes of fire and methods of extinction
	Fire risk assessment
	Fire prevention methods
	Action to be taken in the event of a fire
	Role and responsibilities of the Fire Marshall
	Fire drills
	Firefighting equipment
	Practical Fire Extinguisher use

Fire Marshall Course Assessment Process


	This course is continually assessed by our trainer.
	There is a multi-choice test paper 11/15 pass mark

Fire Marshall Course Renewal Process
Every three years‚Äô delegates will be required to undertake a Fire Marshall Course to renew their qualification and keep their skills fresh.

Refreshments will be provided -¬†If you have a dietary requirement, please let us know by using the 'Special Request' box, indicated with a speech bubble icon, available after adding a ticket to your basket.

Good Skills Training Ltd.

https://goodskillstraining.co.uk/

Good Skills Training bring quality and affordable training and consultancy services to businesses, schools and individuals across Hampshire and the Isle of Wight.
They believe your compliance training should be fun and engaging as well as informative and relevant to your business.
¬†
They offer a full range of training, Health and Safety Services including generic Health and Safety courses, Risk Assessment Training, First Aid Training, COSHH and IOSH.
All courses meet the relevant guidelines for Health and Safety, First Aid and Safeguarding and are fully certificated.

Across the UK, the construction sector is grappling with acute recruitment and employer retention difficulties exacerbated by a lack of skilled workforce and limited diversity.¬†

The new Government‚Äôs target of 300,000 homes per annum contributes towards a positive outlook for the sector, however challenges across the industry include increased material costs, supply chain issues and the present skills shortages, all of which are significant longer-term challenge.



During our initial findings in 2023, the Local Skills Improvement Plan recommended further research into this key sector.
With the forthcoming release of our LSIP Construction deep dive, Hampshire Chamber of Commerce is hosting an interactive roundtable focusing on this sector.

To provide up to date insights, and further outlook within the Construction sector we will be joined by Liz Steel,¬†Customer Engagement Manager for the South East Central Region from CITB.¬†



We‚Äôd like to invite all SME's, businesses, and stakeholders in the industry to take part in the conversation to better understand the local landscape, future skills gaps, and employment challenges.¬†
Please take this opportunity to contribute and benefit to the future of your sector!

Events.summary: The Early November 2024 Portsmouth Guitar Jam
Events.description:
Come and jam with us on the evening of Wednesday 6th November. We have had a cracking last few meetups and this one is going to be no exception!
Celebrate the joy of playing music together with a beer and some fun tunes. It doesn't matter what standard you are - everything we play can be played by anyone with a basic ability for chords! If you can't play guitar but you can sing (or play bass or percussion) then come along too - we always need singers!
We'll tune up, assess standards and then start playing - everyone gets to choose at least 1 song. We have been building a playlist and so far it includes things like:

Sunny Afternoon - Kinks
Hotel California - Eagles
Wish You Were Here - Pink Floyd
Saw Her Standing There - Beatles
After Midnight - JJ Cale
Maggie May - Rod Stewart
Handbags and Gladrags - Rod Stewart/Stereophonics
Folsom Prison Blues - Johnny Cash
Into the Mystic - Van Morrison
The Chain - Fleetwood Mac
The Man Who Sold the World - Bowie

Full list is here
If there is something you want to play then we'll have a crack at that too - we always like to try something new - and suggestions have been as diverse as Dolly Parton (Jolene) and George Michael - and all were a blast! The only warning is that if the song is particularly obscure then you may need to lead the singing too!
We will be at the Barley Mow pub in Southsea.
The more the merrier - so come along whatever your standard (I am distinctly intermediate!) - we play songs that pretty much anyone can play.
If you use Ultimate Guitar Tabs you can also see the tabs we are playing HERE.
If you can, bring a tablet/phone/laptop to bring tabs up on.
Most importantly, bring a couple of songs that you want us to play!
Event Last Updated: 2024-11-06T00:03:58.871Z
Events.location: The Barley Mow, 39 Castle Road, Southsea

Come and join us as we bring out our inner laughter together. This is a friendly and welcoming group, where laughter is the name of the game. No experience necessary.
At a laughter club, we'll be invited to join in with some light-hearted games, activities and meditations that encourage natural laughter and playfulness. You'll feel energised and invigorated, and can share conversation over a drink afterwards with your fellow laughers.
The club is open to all adults who have a willingness to try something new and fun. The proven benefits of laughter yoga include mood elevation, stress reduction, increased energy, emotional balance and increased immunity. Deep belly laughing is also great exercise.
The Serenity Complementary Centre is an ideal venue, with free parking in the small car park and on-street. Wear normal, comfortable clothing and expect serious fun.
Sessions are ¬£7 including refreshments. Come and connect with others as we experience the benefits of real laughter together.

Events.description:
Matthew's parents are worried. At eleven, he's much too old to have an imaginary friend, yet they find him talking to and arguing with a presence that even he admits is not physically there. This presence - Chocky - causes Matthew to ask difficult questions and say startling things: he speaks of complex mathematics and mocks human progress. Then, when Matthew does something incredible, it seems there is more than the imaginary about Chocky. Which is when others become interested and ask questions of their own: who is Chocky? And what could it want with an eleven-year-old boy?
Cost ¬£2 to cover meetup costs

	Discover how skills bootcamps can address specific skill shortages quickly.
	Get insights into the range of bootcamp subjects and how to partner with training providers.

T Levels: Investing in Future Talent


	Gain knowledge about T Levels and their role in preparing students for the workforce.
	Learn how to offer industry placements that provide real-world experience to T Level students.
	Understand the mutual benefits of hosting T Level placements for both students and employers.

Work Experience: Building a Pipeline of Future Employees


	Find out how offering work experience can identify potential future employees early.
	Get tips on creating meaningful work experience programs that benefit both the organization and participants.

Events.description:
Come and join us as we bring out our inner laughter together. This is a friendly and welcoming group, where laughter is the name of the game. No experience necessary.
At a laughter club, we'll be invited to join in with some light-hearted games, activities and meditations that encourage natural laughter and playfulness. You'll feel energised and invigorated, and can share conversation over a drink afterwards with your fellow laughers.
The club is open to all adults who have a willingness to try something new and fun. The proven benefits of laughter yoga include mood elevation, stress reduction, increased energy, emotional balance and increased immunity. Deep belly laughing is also great exercise.
The Serenity Complementary Centre is an ideal venue, with free parking in the small car park and on-street. Wear normal, comfortable clothing and expect serious fun.
Sessions are ¬£7 including refreshments. Come and connect with others as we experience the benefits of real laughter together.
