Events.summary: One Day FAIB Accredited Course -Emergency First Aid at Work
Events.description:
Access to effective, topical, and thematic training, that ensures externally accredited compliance, is at the heart of developing good business practice.

Responding to feedback from members, the Chamber has partnered with Good Skills Training Ltd to deliver a suite of workplace compliance courses. Supported by Fareham College, this partnership will help ensure that employers in our network with more than 5 staff can fulfil their legal obligations while businesses of any kind are supported to create a safe and accessible workplace environment.¬†




Emergency First Aid at Work Course - One Day

Everyone should know a little first aid to be able to assist in an emergency. The Emergency First Aid at Work Course gives people the knowledge that could one day save a life.

Designed specifically with smaller low risk companies in mind, such as small offices, the Emergency First Aid at Work Course meets the legal obligations of these organisations to provide individuals to render first aid in an emergency.

This course is accredited by The First Aid Industry Body

If you have an accessibility requirement, please let us know by using the 'Special Request' box, indicated with a speech bubble icon, available after adding a ticket to your basket. We want to make sure that everyone can attend our events, so please let us know if you might need some additional support.

Refreshments will be provided -¬†If you have a dietary requirement, please let us know by using the 'Special Request' box, indicated with a speech bubble icon, available after adding a ticket to your basket.

Emergency First Aid at Work Course Syllabus

	Responsibilities of the Emergency First Aider
	Primary Assessment
	Secondary Assessment
	CPR & AED
	Seizures and Epilepsy
	Choking
	Shock and Bleeding
	Minor Injuries and Minor Burns
	Plus more

Emergency First Aid at Work Course Assessment Process

This course is assessed through a mixture of practical assessments and theoretical, multiple choice assessments.

Emergency First Aid at Work Course Renewal Process

It is strongly recommended that first aiders undergo an annual ¬Ω day First Aid Refresher Course to keep their skills up to date.

After three years‚Äô delegates must retake an Emergency First Aid at Work Course to keep their qualification valid.

Good Skills Training Ltd.

https://goodskillstraining.co.uk/

Good Skills Training bring quality and affordable training and consultancy services to businesses, schools and individuals across Hampshire and the Isle of Wight.
They believe your compliance training should be fun and engaging as well as informative and relevant to your business.
¬†
They offer a full range of training, Health and Safety Services including generic Health and Safety courses, Risk Assessment Training, First Aid Training, COSHH and IOSH.
All courses meet the relevant guidelines for Health and Safety, First Aid and Safeguarding and are fully certificated.

Events.summary: Christmas Eve Walk - South Hayling (approx 4 miles total)
Events.description:
As I will be sitting doing nothing for the best part of Christmas Day and Boxing Day I'm planning on getting myself into positive credit with the calories on Christmas Eve.
I'd love you to join me on a walk on South Hayling. Starting from Funlands Amusement Park we'll walk down through the bushes/woodland to The Ferryboat Inn. If it's not too busy we can stop for a drinkipoos and some lunch before heading back along the shore.
Approx 1 hour walking (2 miles) out, and the same coming back.

Events.summary: Keeping You Out of Jail ‚Äì A director‚Äôs guide to your legal duties and obligations
Events.description:
Presented by David Joel from Lanson Consultants Ltd

Join David Joel for an insightful 45-minute interactive session designed to help business leaders, owners and directors navigate their legal duties and responsibilities. This session provides a practical guide to understanding the various forms of directors and their distinct legal obligations. The session highlights the fiduciary duties that directors must uphold, such as loyalty, obedience, and care, as codified in the Companies Act 2006. It will address key topics like managing conflicts of interest, exercising independent judgment, and avoiding benefits from third parties.



David also delves into the enforcement of directors' duties, outlining the consequences of breaches, including disqualification, criminal charges, and civil actions. The emphasises the importance of acting in the company‚Äôs best interests and the risks of not doing so. The session concludes by exploring how directors can lose their office and the critical need for compliance with legal obligations to protect both personal and company interests. This session is an essential resource for directors looking to stay compliant and safeguard their company‚Äôs reputation and legal standing.

This is an online session. The link to this will be sent out to those with confirmed bookings ahead of time.

Click here to view David's LinkedIn profile

Events.summary: Mental Health in the Workplace - QNUK Level 2 Award
Events.description:
Access to effective, topical, and thematic training, that ensures externally accredited compliance, is at the heart of developing good business practice.

Responding to feedback from members, the Chamber has partnered with Good Skills Training Ltd to deliver a suite of workplace compliance courses. Supported by BizSpace, this partnership will help ensure that employers in our network with more than 5 staff can fulfil their legal obligations while businesses of any kind are supported to create a safe and accessible workplace environment.



QNUK Level 2 Award in Mental Health at Work

With an increase in poor mental health, it is important that individuals understand their own mental health and how common mental health concerns can be identified in themselves and others, with strategies to reduce the risk.

The QNUK Level 2 Award in Mental Health at Work is the ideal introduction to understanding mental health in the workplace. The qualification covers the most common mental health conditions, how to identify potential mental health concerns in colleagues and then how to discuss their needs and assist them to access suitable services and support.

Good Skills Training are experts at delivering the QNUK Level 2 Award in Mental Health at Work in an enjoyable and interactive way.

Who is the Course For?

	Anyone with an interest in¬†mental health at work
	Anyone with an interest in their own mental health

Course Syllabus:


	Be aware of common mental health disorders
	Know how to recognise the causes and impact of stress
	Know how to recognise the causes and impact of common mental health conditions
	Understand how individuals may use harmful strategies to cope with a mental health disorder
	Know how to support an individual with a mental health issue

Prerequisites:
This qualification is available to those over 18 years. Due to the language of the assessment, it is recommended that learners have enough command of the English language in order to understand the assessment and to undertake the recommended assessment methods.¬†

Awarding Body:
OFQUAL regulated qualification through Qualifications Network (QNUK)¬†¬†

Assessment Method:
The QNUK Level 2 Award in Mental Health at Work is assessed by written multiple choice assessment

Refreshments and Lunch will be provided -¬†If you have a dietary requirement, please let us know by using the 'Special Request' box, indicated with a speech bubble icon, available after adding a ticket to your basket.

Good Skills Training Ltd.

https://goodskillstraining.co.uk/

Good Skills Training bring quality and affordable training and consultancy services to businesses, schools and individuals across Hampshire and the Isle of Wight.
They believe your compliance training should be fun and engaging as well as informative and relevant to your business.
¬†
They offer a full range of training, Health and Safety Services including generic Health and Safety courses, Risk Assessment Training, First Aid Training, COSHH and IOSH.
All courses meet the relevant guidelines for Health and Safety, First Aid and Safeguarding and are fully certificated.

Events.summary: Emergency First Aid at Work - One Day FAIB Accredited Course
Events.description:
Access to effective, topical, and thematic training, that ensures externally accredited compliance, is at the heart of developing good business practice.

Responding to feedback from members, the Chamber has partnered with Good Skills Training Ltd to deliver a suite of workplace compliance courses. Supported by Fareham College, this partnership will help ensure that employers in our network with more than 5 staff can fulfil their legal obligations while businesses of any kind are supported to create a safe and accessible workplace environment.¬†



Emergency First Aid at Work Course - One Day

Everyone should know a little first aid to be able to assist in an emergency. The Emergency First Aid at Work Course gives people the knowledge that could one day save a life.

Designed specifically with smaller low risk companies in mind, such as small offices, the Emergency First Aid at Work Course meets the legal obligations of these organisations to provide individuals to render first aid in an emergency.

Events.summary: Walk and Talk for cancer loss, Hampshire, Havant Coastal Walk, 29.12.24
Events.description:
On Sunday 29th December 2024 we will be hosting an informal walk and talk event around the Havant Coast.
This event is specifically for people who have lost a loved one to cancer. This event is for people aged 18 and over.
Where are we walking?
The walk will start in Havant and follow the Hayling Billy Trail south to Chichester Harbour. If the tide allows we will head along the beach to Warblington then return back. It will last approximately an hour.
Can anyone take part?
Our walk is open to any adult who has had a loved one die from cancer. The aim is to give you space to meet and talk with others who have experienced a similar loss, which our users tell us they find extremely helpful.
We will be limiting the number of walkers to 11 people so that we do not have too large a walking group. One of our volunteers will be hosting the event to walk and talk alongside you.
Please note that we do not allow guests unless you let us know in advance (as we are capping the number of attendees for each walk).
Pets and children are also not able to attend.
What are the timings for the day?
Walkers will be meeting at 10:00am and starting at 10:15am.
We aim to complete the walk, at approximately 11:15am.
Do I need to be a professional walker?
Definitely not. The event is about being together, spending time with others who have experienced similar things, and being outdoors. It‚Äôs not about being fit or racing.
How do I get involved?
To register for this event you will need to complete the registration form below:
https://survey.eu.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_cO6lDQM4jfSsGXA
Once completed you will receive an email confirming your place and with full details for the walk.
We are unable to respond to messages through MeetUp outside of office working hours. If you are having any difficulty with registering for the group, please email us at hello@thelossfoundation.org rather than through MeetUp and we will get back to you as soon as we can.
Please note that we are not a crisis service, so if you are in need of immediate support please do reach out to Samaritans who provide immediate listening support. They can be reached on 116 123.
Event Last Updated: 2024-12-29T00:00:39.335Z
Events.location: The Spring Arts & Heritage Centre, 56 East Street, Havant

Events.summary: Why do businesses need a defined Purpose ‚Äì A Business Leader's guide to Purpose and Intent based leadership
Events.description:
Presented by David Joel from Lanson Consultants Ltd

In today‚Äôs fast-moving and unpredictable world, businesses face constant change, complexity, and uncertainty. This presentation, A Director‚Äôs Guide to Purpose and Intent-Based Leadership by David Joel, explores how a clearly defined purpose helps organisations navigate this environment with clarity and confidence. A strong purpose aligns leadership, shapes culture, and drives strategic decision-making. Directors are jointly responsible for setting this purpose, along with the organisation‚Äôs vision and values. They must lead with entrepreneurial spirit, ensuring the right balance between ambition and effective governance. The Leaders role is to create a shared purpose ¬†to drive and enable people across the organisation. Freeing them to act with intent, agility, and responsibility.



Purpose-led leadership requires more than top-down control‚Äîit calls for trust, visibility, and authentic communication. Inspired by L. David Marquet‚Äôs intent-based leadership model, this guide reframes leadership as a practice rooted in purpose rather than personality. High-performing teams are built on clarity, shared goals, and mutual respect. Leaders must know when to take the reins and when to step back, giving others the space and authority to lead. When purpose is embedded across the organisation, people feel proud, valued, and accountable‚Äînot just for outcomes, but for the greater mission. This is leadership that not only drives performance but fosters a culture of ownership, adaptability, and sustained success.

This is an online session. The link to this will be sent out to those with confirmed bookings ahead of time.

Events.description:
How Speed Dating Works in Portsmouth
When you arrive at the Portsmouth venue you will be greeted by our friendly professional hosts. Once everyone has arrived and registered we will briefly explain the format of the evening. The ladies will then be asked to make their way to their allocated table. Once the ladies are seated the gentlemen will be asked to proceed to their first date.
You will have 4 minutes to chat to each date, once the 4 minutes is over we will ring a bell to indicate the time is up and for the gentlemen to move to their next date. Four minutes is long enough to see if you click with the person you are talking to and whether you would like to see them again and also short enough if you don't.
At the end of each date you have a brief few moments to make some notes on the person you have just dated. This is something to help jog your memory for the post event matching process the next day.
Half way through the event you will have an interval break so you can nip to the toilet or top up your drink.
Once all the dates are over you have the opportunity to stay on at the venue to mingle freely with others. Please remember to take your dating card home with you to assist you in entering in your ticks and potential matches.
Post Event
No later than 11am the following morning our matching system will be unlocked for you to enter your ticks from the previous evening. You have all day to tick as many people as you like from the night before. We guarantee you will find someone you will want to see again, otherwise we will give you your next Speed Dating event for free!
### Itinerary
19:00 Registration Starts
19:30 Speed Dating starts
20:15 Interval for drinks, mingling and relaxing!
20:30 Speed Dating continues
21:15/21:30 Speed Dating concludes, followed by optional post-event socializing
*Please note the times for the event interval and finish are approximates and will depend of the number of daters at the event.
IMPORTANT: The number of attendees on MeetUp doesn`t reflect the real situation as we sell the majority of tickets on other platforms. Please bear this in mind. You can find more information here: [https://bit.ly/3dm7Lju](https://bit.ly/3dm7Lju)
Please note that our bookings team work standard UK business hours - if you book outside of these hours, your confirmation from Slowdating will be processed once the bookings team are in.

Come and join us for the latest South Coast Digital Marketing event on Thursday 13th March at Aspex Gallery, Portsmouth!
Come to Aspex Portsmouth, a stunning gallery space in Gunwharf Quays, for an evening filled with insightful talks on Digital Marketing and plenty of networking opportunities.
And if you don‚Äôt want the evening to end, you can head out to one of Gunwharf Quays‚Äô many restaurants and bars for more fun!
And this event is completely FREE! In fact, instead of charging for tickets, we‚Äôre donating the cost of your ticket to charity, so by attending, you‚Äôre also making a difference.
What's more, we're also providing complimentary drinks during the evening!
Space is limited, so don‚Äôt miss out ‚Äì sign up now to secure your free ticket!
What to expect on the night!
Doors will open from 6pm where you can grab a drink and network if you wish.
6:30 pm - We will hear from the amazing Jonjo Rowlands where he will look into "Why We Click. The Psychology Behind Digital Decisions."
7 pm - Sean Carroll will take to the stage as he discusses "How to Get 30K Clicks Per Month with Effective Keyword Research"
7:30 pm - Hear we will have a short break and a chance for you to network with the people in the room.
8:00 pm - Hear from our panel debate featuring Robert Taylor and Charlotte Stanley as they battle it out over the topic: AI - Gamechanger or Creativity Killer
8:30 pm - Stay and network or feel free to start making your way home!
How to get there
Aspex Portsmouth is located in the characteristic Vulcan Building in Portsmouth‚Äôs Gunwharf Quays, next to the city‚Äôs waterfront.

Events.summary: 3 day long weekend - POOLE. Thursday 13th. To. Sunday 16th March.  2025
Events.description:
## Details
Join us on board on Thursday evening in Haslar marina, Gosport. Meet the crew and discuss the final passage plan over a glass of wine and delicious home cooked evening meal which we aim to serve at 20.00.
Friday morning we will set sail - the destination will be determined by the weather and crew preferences - we may sail past the iconic the Needles to Poole or eastwards to Eastbourne or Brighton.
Whether you are a novice or old hand come and enjoy a fun exhilarating weekend. There is the opportunity to be involved in all aspects of sailing - helming, sail trimming, navigation.
Our yacht is a Dufour 385GL, MCA coded with full safety equipment. The skipper and first mate are experienced RYA qualified sailors so you do not need any prior sailing experience to join this trip.
The price of ¬£355 for a shared cabin includes

one evening meal on board
breakfasts, lunches, snacks
tea, coffee, soft drinks
marina fees, gas, fuel
all safety equipment

Not included

meals ashore
travel to and from the yacht
travel insurance

Interested?
Email maggiesmith77@hotmail.com. Complete a booking form and pay deposit of ¬£50. Balance due 28 days before the event.
Any questions just call Maggie on 0771 2525368 or Chris on 07751 212976
NB. If you RSVP you must contact me. Thank you.
##

Events.summary: The Mid March 2025 Portsmouth Guitar Jam
Events.description:
Come and jam with us on the evening of Tuesday 18th March. We have had a cracking last few meetups and this one is going to be no exception!
Celebrate the joy of playing music together with a beer and some fun tunes. It doesn't matter what standard you are - everything we play can be played by anyone with a basic ability for chords! If you can't play guitar but you can sing (or play bass or percussion) then come along too - we always need singers!
We'll tune up, assess standards and then start playing - everyone gets to choose at least 1 song. We have been building a playlist and so far it includes things like:

Sunny Afternoon - Kinks
Hotel California - Eagles
Wish You Were Here - Pink Floyd
Saw Her Standing There - Beatles
After Midnight - JJ Cale
Maggie May - Rod Stewart
Handbags and Gladrags - Rod Stewart/Stereophonics
Folsom Prison Blues - Johnny Cash
Crazy - Gnarls Barkley
Viva La Vida - Coldplay
The Chain - Fleetwood Mac
The Man Who Sold the World - Bowie

Full list is here
If there is something you want to play then we'll have a crack at that too - we always like to try something new - and suggestions have been as diverse as Dolly Parton (Jolene) and George Michael - and all were a blast! The only warning is that if the song is particularly obscure then you may need to lead the singing too!
We will be at the Barley Mow pub in Southsea.
The more the merrier - so come along whatever your standard (I am distinctly intermediate!) - we play songs that pretty much anyone can play.
If you use Ultimate Guitar Tabs you can also see the tabs we are playing HERE.
If you can, bring a tablet/phone/laptop to bring tabs up on.
Most importantly, bring a couple of songs that you want us to play!
Event Last Updated: 2025-03-10T00:18:31.178Z
Events.location: The Barley Mow, 39 Castle Road, Southsea

Open to all, and inclusive for members, Chamber Connects! gives you the fantastic opportunity to meet a variety of like-minded business professionals who come together regularly for 2 hours of facilitated networking. This collaborative approach is designed to ensure that the best connections are made and that all who attend can speak to the majority of those in the room.

Working in collaboration with¬†Mark Jones from Destination Basingstoke, this event is run by Barry Smith.



What will you get from attending?

	Connect with those new to Chamber membership.
	The chance to spotlight your business, demonstrate your expertise, and develop your reputation in your local business community.
	Learn more about an interesting Hampshire location and business.
	Be among the first to hear the latest updates from your Chamber and its partner network.


We kindly ask that no more than 2 representatives from each organisation attend these events. This is to help make sure that everyone has the best networking experience as possible.

Events.summary: Preparing to comply with EU and global sustainability regulation
Events.description:
Preparing to comply with EU and global sustainability regulation

Global regulation need not always be a stressful burden, it can present significant opportunities for differentiation, diversification, and expansion. Small businesses have the benefit of agility over their corporate counterparts, however when they encounter regulation for which they are ill-prepared, they are prone to making knee jerk reactions, expensive mistakes, and incurring unnecessary expense trying to comply last minute e.g. recent panic due to EU General Product Safety Regulation (GPSR).



Sustainability regulation at both the EU and global level is already impacting small UK businesses in terms of carbon reporting and recycling levies, however, regulation is only set to increase in scope and reach, it is not going away. Whilst the EU spearheads much regulation; with the establishment of the International Sustainability Standards Board (ISSB) in 2023, countries such as Australia, Canada, Japan, Singapore, and an increasing number of US states are now establishing their own local legislation to comply with ISSB standards.

By understanding what regulation is to be introduced and when, it is possible to cost-effectively plan, and take pragmatic, manageable steps towards compliance so that you can exploit global trade opportunities. Sustainability regulation will dramatically alter the way we trade globally; those companies willing to work towards compliance seek to gain market share from those inevitably forced to withdraw due to inability to comply.

Join Hampshire Chamber of Commerce for this one-hour webinar to gain insight into the global sustainability regulatory landscape, including an overview of the new EU Product Packaging Waste Regulation (PPWR) coming into force this year and imposing new obligations on Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR). Importantly, this webinar will share practical advice on what you can do to work towards compliance and future-proofing your global trade.

About our speaker:

Andrea Collins
MIEx, MBA, BA (Hons)



Andrea is an international trade specialist with 25+ years‚Äô experience in the industry. A linguist fluent in French and Spanish, Andrea specializes in importing, exporting, global sustainability, trade compliance, business resilience, and business growth. A passionate ambassador of UK micro businesses and SMEs, she launched Global Trade Department (previously known as The Export Department) to assist these companies expand their horizons internationally, raise the profile of UK goods and services abroad, and add vital resilience to supply chains through global sourcing.¬†¬†

When:¬† Wednesday 12th March
Time:¬† 10am - 11am
Delivered by Zoom call
Cost:¬† free of charge

Includes a Q & A session

Join us on 12th March to find out more

In partnership with

Events.summary: Let's visit Port Solent Sunday market & have a bite to eat afterwards
Events.description:
Let's meet up at Port Solent for a browse around the market stalls on the boardwalk and then go for a bite to eat afterwards. The Wetherspoons pub, Sir Alec Rose, has a menu which should suit everyone. It also has great views of the marina.
Held on the second Sunday of the month from April until November 2025, Port Solent's Waterside Market is home to over 50 stalls.
Port Solent's Sunday Waterside Markets are a must-visit. The market offers a diverse range of goods and services, from fresh produce and artisanal food products to handmade crafts and gifts. With so much to choose from and a variety of food and drink vendors on site, it's the perfect way to spend a relaxing Sunday.
Several of the shops in Port Solent will also be open, such as Klass, Pavers shoes & Cotton Traders.
Whether you're looking to shop for unique items or just enjoy the atmosphere, the Sunday Waterside Markets are not to be missed.
Parking free at Port Solent but it's probably a good idea to get there early as it can get quite busy. Sometimes there is a classic car display in part of the car park as well and that can take up quite a lot of the parking spaces.
Please remove your name from the 'attending' list if you change your mind about coming along - thanks!

Events.summary: Chamber Connects! at Army Flying Museum
Events.description:
Join businesses from all over the County as we visit the Army Flying Museum for a morning of facilitated networking.

Open to all, and inclusive for members, Chamber Connects! gives you the fantastic opportunity to meet a variety of like-minded business professionals who come together regularly for 2 hours of facilitated networking. This collaborative approach is designed to ensure that the best connections are made and that all who attend can speak to the majority of those in the room.

Working in collaboration with Mark Jones from Destination Basingstoke, the whole event is led by Barry Smith from Hampshire Chamber of Commerce.¬†¬†





"Chamber Connects! Events are well planned and run smoothly. I like the way we move tables to have many conversations with different business owners as well as a general 60 second pitch if wanted."

What will you get from attending?


	Engage with others in the Chamber‚Äôs PEER network through Facilitated Networking
	Connect with those new to Chamber membership.
	The chance to spotlight your business, demonstrate your expertise, and develop your reputation in your local business community.
	Learn more about an interesting Hampshire location and business.
	Be among the first to hear the latest updates from your Chamber and its partner network.


If you have an accessibility requirement, please let us know by using the 'Special Request' box, indicated with a speech bubble icon, available after adding a ticket to your basket. We want to make sure that everyone can attend our events, so please let us know if you might need some additional support.

Refreshments will be provided -¬†If you have a dietary requirement, please let us know by using the 'Special Request' box, indicated with a speech bubble icon, available after adding a ticket to your basket.



Chamber Connects! will be held every 1st and 3rd Wednesday of the month from February ‚Äì December 2025 (and onwards!).¬†¬†
We expect this to be a well-attended event, capped at 60 attendees - so book soon to avoid disappointment!¬†¬†

The Army Flying Museum


The Army Flying Museum is the only Museum in the world that tells the extraordinary story of British Army Flying.¬† Two large hangars house the impressive journey of British soldiers in the air from the pioneering days of balloons and kites to the Glider Pilot Regiment landing at Arnhem, right through to modern helicopter operations. Often likened to the Tardis, visitors are frequently met with surprise at the volume of artefacts, medals and over thirty-five fixed wing and rotary aircraft. Imaginative displays with a clever use of interactives and video provide for fascinating insight into the history of British Army flying.

The Museum underwent a major transformation in 2019 featuring new displays, interactives and AV shows to engage visitors of all ages. The refurbishment also saw the completion of a dignified memorial to more than 5,000 that have died in the service of British Army flying from early pioneers to the modern Army Air Corps.

Louise Mackay from the Army Flying Museum will be giving short talk on the morning - 'Sponsorship of the Army Flying Museum'

Please note: There are no limits on the number of times non-members can attend Chamber Connects!¬†(The standard non-member two visit restriction applies to all other Chamber events.)

	Unlocking the benefits of AI in business

There will be training to cover topics such as deepening understanding of neurodivergence and the job roles this may complement, psychological safety in the workplace and supporting staff culture as well as hearing from other organisation‚Äôs working to the gold inclusive standard. ¬†

Events.summary: Finance is Too Important to Be Left to the Accountants: Part 1 ‚Äì A Business Leader‚Äôs Guide to the Key Financial Statements
Events.description:
Presented by David Joel from Lanson Consultants Ltd

This engaging 45-minute workshop offers business leaders, entrepreneurs, and professionals without a formal finance background a practical and accessible introduction to the key financial statements. As the first in a two-part series, the session focuses on demystifying finance by reframing it not as a numbers game, but as a way of telling a business‚Äôs story. Participants will gain a clearer understanding of how strategy and financial performance are closely linked, learning how to interpret the core financial documents that shape critical decisions: the Balance Sheet (Statement of Financial Position), the Income Statement (Profit and Loss Account), and Cash Flow .



Designed to be highly interactive, the workshop equips attendees with the confidence to engage in financial conversations and assess business performance using simple yet powerful methods. By unpacking the principles behind the numbers, the session enables participants to make informed business decisions and better understand the language of business. Whether you're steering a start-up or leading a growing enterprise, this workshop will give you the financial confidence to drive your business forward.

Events.summary: The Mid April 2025 Portsmouth Guitar Jam
Events.description:
Come and jam with us on the evening of Tuesday 15th April. We have had a cracking last few meetups and this one is going to be no exception!
Celebrate the joy of playing music together with a beer and some fun tunes. It doesn't matter what standard you are - everything we play can be played by anyone with a basic ability for chords! If you can't play guitar but you can sing (or play bass or percussion) then come along too - we always need singers!
We'll tune up, assess standards and then start playing - everyone gets to choose at least 1 song. We have been building a playlist and so far it includes things like:

Sunny Afternoon - Kinks
Hotel California - Eagles

Saw Her Standing There - Beatles

Maggie May - Rod Stewart

Crazy - Gnarls Barkley

Full list is here

We will be at the Barley Mow pub in Southsea.

Events.summary: 5 day Easter weekend sail to St Vaast Thursday 17th April- Monday 21st April
Events.description:
This is always a very popular destination and when you arrive you will understand why!
Join us on board in Haslar marina, Gosport on Thursday evening at 18.00. We will discuss the final passage plan for the weekend over a delicious home cooked evening meal. Weather permitting we plan to sail to St Vaast overnight, arriving by midday Friday .
We will spend the afternoon,evening and Saturday morning in St Vaast, giving you an opportunity to explore the oyster capital of Normandy, visit the market, the famous shop of monsieur Grosselin, the Vauban tower or go across to ile Tatihou.
Saturday late morning we plan to set sail to Cherbourg where we will spend the evening and overnight. Sunday sail back to either Yarmouth or Lymington, returning to Haslar on Monday.
There will be lots of sailing and time to explore ashore - adventure, excitement and escape
The final passage plan will depend on the wind and weather. We can guarantee that we will be able to tailor the trip to the conditions to ensure a quality sailing experience.
This is an ideal mile builder for those requiring sea miles and possibly night hours. There may be an opportunity to skipper a 60 mile passage under supervision. Just call to discuss.
Whether you are a novice or experienced sailor you will love this trip! Take the helm, trim the sails, navigate ‚Ä¶.. or just come and relax.
Our yacht is a Dufour 385, MCA coded with full safety equipment. The skipper and first mate are experienced RYA qualified sailors so you do not need any prior sailing experience to join this trip.
The price of ¬£550 for a shared cabin includes:

One evening meal on board
breakfasts, lunches, tea, coffee, snacks.
marina fees, gas and fuel.
Skipper and first mate

Not included

meals taken ashore
travel insurance.

To book please email maggiesmith77@hotmail.com. Please call Maggie on 07712525368 or Chris on 07751212976 if you have any questions.
We ask for a deposit of ¬£100 to secure your place and the balance 28 days before the event.

Events.summary: Amazing Easter Sailing trip with overnight sailing.
Events.description:
Short Weekends Friday to Sunday
Friday Evening
Meetup 7:30-8pm on the Lightship PO12 1NU
A special place to start our weekend adventure. Here we‚Äôll get to know our crew mates, talk about your experiences and what we have in mind for the weekends sailing. The lightship is stationed within the Boatfolk marina at Gosport and is managed by the wonderful Maria. There we‚Äôll have the option of just drinks or if you haven‚Äôt eaten the dinner comes highly recommended.
As the evening draws to a close and we‚Äôre done on the lightship, we‚Äôll head on over to Wolverine, a Rob Humphreys designed Elan 450, one of just two sports luxury cruisers in northern Europe. After a few tunes and perhaps a nightcap we‚Äôll get settled down ready for the cruise the following morning.
Saturday, early rise and prep Wolverine to set sail whilst we have breakfast, one lucky volunteer heads up the pontoon to get the hot rolls. For those who are learning prepare your passage & sail plan to our selected destination, for those that are here just to enjoy the adventure, pop the kettle on üòä
08:30 we‚Äôll start getting you ready for the day, which includes the fitment of life jackets and our usual safety briefing.
09:15 lets go!! Our sailing area depends on wind tide and selected destination, which can include Cowes, Hamble, Bucklers Hard, Lymington, Yarmouth, Poole Harbour and a few off-grid anchorages with tender trips up onto the beach.
Saturday evening we‚Äôll get into the best pub / restaurant possible for great food and wherever we can live music and some dancing for those who still have wobbly sea legs, LoL!
Sunday, we‚Äôll do it all in reverse, however this time you‚Äôll have greater autonomy at which ever level you‚Äôre at [beginners and experienced], but don‚Äôt panic the skipper will be by your side keeping you safe and informed.
Long Weekends [This one]
Subject to the weather we try and get away with a night sail to enjoy the night stars and dancing phosphorescence in the water. Our destinations are a little further afield and appeal to those who have sailed before and those building their sea miles / night sailing hours. If you have not tried it before then it can be an amazing and spiritual experience.
Meetup 19:00hrs on the advertised departure date
Brief at 19:30
Set sail 20:30 overnight to some other amazing place. You will be divided into two shifts with skipper and mate. Our shift pattern will be 3 hours on a three hours off, starting at 21:00hrs.
Return trip will depend on our final weekend plan, but may incorporate another overnight sail!
Are you ready to sign up - Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll need:


A great sense of humour and adventure


Waterproof jacket and trousers


Your own water carrier, [saving plastics at sea]


Sun cream / sunglasses you never can tell in the winter


Wash bag and towel


Sleeping bag and pillowcase [we got the pillow]


Layered clothes in a soft bag for storage


Hat and sailing gloves


Non-marking out deck shoes


Head torch and passports for the long weekends.


Life jackets will be allocated on arrival and are to be worn whilst sailing


Personal sports insurances


What to leave behind

A bad week, it‚Äôs gonna get a lot better!

Events.summary: Portsmouth, Isle of Wight and South Downs ‚Äì Easter Bank Holiday Weekend
Events.description:
A chance to explore the South Downs, Portsmouth and the Isle of Wight on a fun packed Easter hiking weekend.
Friday 18 April, Meet from 6pm at the Pembroke Pub (20 Pembroke Road, Old Portsmouth, PO1 2NR) for a a short one hour historical walk starting at 6.30pm.
Saturday 19 April. A circular hike (15miles/24km) from Rowlands Castle into Stanstead Forest and then to Bow Hill and the Kindley National Nature Reserve following sections of the Monarch‚Äôs Way across the South Downs. We will have a snack lunch stop just before halfway at the village of Stoughton close to a pub.
We will aim to get the 9.38am train from Portsmouth & Southsea Station (Commercial Road, Portsmouth, PO1 1EH) that arrives at Rowlands Castle for 9.59am (meet outside Portsmouth & Southsea at 9.15am.
Return tickets is approx. ¬£7 (with travel card or group save). Regular trains back from Rowlands Castle to Portsmouth after the hike. Portsmouth & Southsea station is a 16min walk from Portsmouth Harbour station or you could get the 9.29am train and change at Portsmouth & Southsea if your accommodation is closer to Portsmouth Harbour.
Sunday 20 April. A linear hike from Ryde to Sandown (13.5miles/22km) The hike follows the coastal path and Yar river trail along to Bembridge Down and finishing at Sandown (chance of swim if the weather is nice).
We will aim for the 10.15am Wight link ferry from Portsmouth Hard ferry port (need to meet from 9.45 to get tickets and board ferry) that gets to Ryde for 10.37am. Ferry is ¬£28.20 for a day return (Portsmouth Harbour station, The Hard Interchange, Portsmouth, Hampshire, PO1 3PA).
The ferry is at the end of the rail station next to the harbour.
At Sandown there are regular trains back to Ryde, 20minutes (¬£3.10 single with group save or network railcard) the last ferry from Ryde to Portsmouth is 23.10pm.
Monday 21 April. (8miles/12km). A linear hike from Havant to South Hayling Island along the Hayling Billy Coastal Path.
Meet at 10.10am outside Portsmouth & Southsea Station to get the 10.33am train getting to Havant for 10.46am. Single ticket ¬£5.90. At the end of the walk we can get the Hayling Island ferry from Langstone Harbour to Eastney Portsmouth. Ferries run till 1800 one per hour. There is a pub next to the ferry, the Ferry Boat Inn! Adult single ticket ¬£3.50.
Buses go back from the ferry at Eastney to Portsmouth till 16.34pm or from Bransbury Park at 18.13pm and 20.13pm (35min walk from Ferry)
There is also the option to walk back along the Southsea Seafront to Portsmouth Harbour (4.5miles/7km) or Uber!
HIKES FOR THIS WEEKEND MAY BE DEMANDING WITH UNDULATING ROUGH TERRAIN.
Please make a note of the organizers numbers - Colin 07709305681.
A watsapp group has been set up for the trip.
Hike Cost/Meetup/organizer: ¬£39 (organizer hike fee) or 13 if you just want to do each hike as a day hike. As this is a weekend away trip we need payment in advance, please contact the organizer by meetup message for details.
Transport and accommodation needs to be booked yourselves. Please do this ASAP for accommodation in particular. Many booking sites offer free cancellation and prices often go up nearer the date..
Parking could be expensive in Portsmouth. If you don't mind walking there are free residential roadside parking in some areas on the edge of town. (please check for any restrictions).
Trains go to Portsmouth from London Waterloo station.
A watsapp group will be set up for this trip. Please contact the organizer if you want to be added...
Walking Safety: Walking is a great way to keep fit and generally very safe; however it does contain an element of risk. Before going on any of these walks you need to be reasonably fit and be prepared to be responsible for your own safety. You should wear appropriate clothing such as proper walking boots, warm and wet weather clothing and carry sufficient food and water. Please see our Terms and Conditions (https://www.meetup.com/Chiltern-Explorers/pages/Terms_and_Conditions/)
COULD EVERYONE PLEASE AVOID COMMENTS BELOW THAT ARE NOT SPECIFIC TO THE EVENT AS THIS GENERATES SPAM, JUST CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF YOU CAN'T GO. YOU CAN MESSAGE ME. MANY THANKS.
Event Last Updated: 2025-04-15T00:01:51.300Z
Events.location: The Isambard Kingdom Brundel, 2 Guidhall Walk, Portsmouth

Events.summary: Walk and Talk for cancer loss, Hampshire, Havant Coastal Walk, 20.04.25
Events.description:
On Sunday 20th April 2025 we will be hosting an informal walk and talk event around the Havant Coast.
![img](https://i0.wp.com/thelossfoundation.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/IMG_20241117_102652.jpg?resize=1024%2C768&ssl=1)
Who is this walk for?
This walk is for adults (18+) who have lost a loved one to cancer. It‚Äôs a space to connect with others who truly understand, in a supportive and relaxed environment.
Where will we be walking?
We‚Äôll begin in Havant and follow the scenic Hayling Billy Trail down to Chichester Harbour. If the tide allows, we‚Äôll stroll along the beach to Warblington before heading back. The walk will take about an hour and is designed to be gentle and enjoyable.
Feeling nervous?
We understand that joining a group like this might feel daunting ‚Äì it‚Äôs completely normal to feel unsure. Many of our walkers have felt the same way at first. Rest assured, this is a welcoming and supportive space. You can take things at your own pace, and there‚Äôs no pressure to talk more than you feel comfortable. Here is a quote from one of our previous walkers:
‚ÄúIt was a small enough group that we could engage in deeper conversation. We all went for coffee afterwards. Honestly, the best grief event I‚Äôve ever attended. Thank you Loss Foundation!!‚Äù
What to expect:

A small group of up to 10 walkers to keep things intimate and comfortable.
A friendly volunteer host who will walk and chat with you, making sure everyone feels at ease.
The chance to spend time outdoors with people who‚Äôve experienced similar loss.

We ask that you let us know in advance if you‚Äôd like to bring a guest (as spaces are limited) and kindly note that pets and children cannot join the walk.
What are the timings for the day?
Walkers will be meeting at 10:00am. We aim to complete the walk just over one hour later, at approximately 11:15am.
Who is the host?
Our lovely volunteer Steve will be hosting this walk. Look out for his friendly face on arrival.
![img](https://i0.wp.com/thelossfoundation.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/IMG_20241008_170110.jpg?resize=200%2C300&ssl=1)
Do I need to be an experienced walker?
Not at all! This walk isn‚Äôt about fitness or speed. It‚Äôs about being outdoors, meeting others, and finding comfort in shared experiences. Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned walker or a total beginner, you‚Äôre very welcome.
Ready to join us?
Sign up by completing the registration form below, and we‚Äôll send you an email with all the details you need to take part.
https://survey.eu.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_3JG1cVqbkYsPfJI
Once completed you will receive an email confirming your place and with full details for the walk.
We are unable to respond to messages through MeetUp outside of office working hours. If you are having any difficulty with registering for the group, please email us at hello@thelossfoundation.org rather than through MeetUp and we will get back to you as soon as we can.
Please note that we do not allow guests unless you let us know in advance (as we are capping the number of attendees for each walk).
Pets and children are also not able to attend.
Please note that we are not a crisis service, so if you are in need of immediate support please do reach out to Samaritans who provide immediate listening support. They can be reached on 116 123.
We send all participants a short survey after the session to get their feedback so that we can improve our services for all. Thank you for your contribution in helping us improve our support.
Event Last Updated: 2025-04-15T00:02:33.146Z
Events.location: The Spring Arts & Heritage Centre, 56 East Street, Havant

Events.description:
The Hampshire Sustainable Action Network (HSAN) is a practical support network for small and medium-sized businesses across the county who want to make progress on sustainability in a way that fits with their day-to-day operations.

We know that for many businesses, sustainability can feel like a stretch ‚Äì something that‚Äôs hard to prioritise when time, money and capacity are already tight. HSAN is here to make it easier, more achievable, and more relevant.

The network runs bimonthly events and supports a growing peer group of business leaders who are working towards more sustainable ways of operating. These sessions are designed to be useful and straightforward. Each one includes structured networking, a tour of a host business, a practical talk from an expert, and space for discussion and problem-solving. Between events, members stay connected through updates, shared resources and informal support.




What makes HSAN different is its tone. There‚Äôs no jargon, no pressure to be perfect, and no push towards any one accreditation or scheme. Businesses are encouraged to identify three realistic priorities, things they can do, and share their progress with the group. This helps others learn, builds confidence, and keeps the focus on what‚Äôs achievable.

The network is open to businesses at any stage. Whether you‚Äôre just starting out or already making changes, HSAN offers a space to learn from others, ask questions, and find support. It‚Äôs not about ticking boxes ‚Äì it‚Äôs about making steady progress and celebrating what works.

Members are also encouraged to bring their challenges to the group. Whether it‚Äôs a technical issue, a communications question, or something sector-specific, the idea is to find better solutions together. The network is designed to be flexible, responsive and shaped by its members.

If you‚Äôre looking for a no-nonsense way to explore sustainability, HSAN offers the structure, space and peer support to help you get started ‚Äì and keep going.

Events.summary: Why do business leaders find strategy difficult? ‚Äì A Business Leader's guide to strategic planning and decision making
Events.description:
Presented by David Joel from Lanson Consultants Ltd

In this engaging 45-minute session, David Joel of Lanson Consultants you on a journey to explore why businesses often find strategy difficult. Through a mix of real-world examples, interactive discussions, and hands-on exercises, he highlights the common pitfalls organisations face - such as lack of vision, poor situational awareness, and short-term pressures that hinder long-term thinking. Participants are encouraged to reflect on who truly holds responsibility for strategy within their business, examining the vital interplay between leadership, governance, and decision-making. The distinction between strategy and tactics is clearly laid out, helping attendees understand the importance of focusing on the bigger picture, not just the day-to-day delivery.



The session also equips leaders with practical tools, such as the SFA (Suitability, Feasibility, Acceptability) framework, to evaluate strategic options effectively. With a focus on operating in today‚Äôs world, the session will help empower you to lead strategic development with greater clarity, purpose, and confidence. David closes the session with key takeaways that reinforce a directors' role in setting and sustaining a successful strategy, leaving you better prepared to navigate your organisation‚Äôs future.

This is an online session. The link to this will be sent out to those with confirmed bookings ahead of time.

Events.summary: CPR and Defibrillator Training with Hampshire and Isle of Wight Air Ambulance
Events.description:
Cardiac Arrests are the most called to incidents for Hampshire and Isle of Wight Air Ambulance‚Äôs Critical Care Teams. But did you know that¬†fewer than 1 in 10 survive¬†an out of hospital cardiac arrest?

For every minute that someone is in cardiac arrest without receiving CPR and early defibrillation, their chance of survival decreases by 10%. Early defibrillation within 3‚Äì5 minutes of collapse can increase survival rates by up to 50-70%.



Provided by Hampshire and Isle of Wight Air Ambulance, we are proud to be offering this to our Members.

Book on to this FREE to members training to learn valuable skills.

You will learn how to assess a patient, call for help, how to perform effective chest compressions, and how to use a defibrillator. This is not a qualification, but the understanding, knowledge and confidence that might save someone‚Äôs life.

To find out more information, follow the below link:
CPR Skills for Life | Hampshire and Isle of Wight Air Ambulance

Events.summary: Driving the business forward ‚Äì A Business Leader's guide to leading your company
Events.description:
Presented by David Joel from Lanson Consultants Ltd

In this highly interactive, 45-minute session, David Joel offers business leaders a practical, thought-provoking guide to effective leadership at board level. The session begins by unpacking the fundamental responsibilities of a board‚Äîsetting vision, purpose, and values, providing entrepreneurial leadership, and maintaining effective oversight in a VUCA (Volatile, Uncertain, Complex, Ambiguous) world. David highlights the unique pressures directors face, including the need to ensure adequate resources, evaluate management performance, and balance stakeholder demands. He explores the ‚Äúparadoxes of leadership‚Äù ‚Äì such as reconciling ownership with governance and vision with control ‚Äì and illustrates how great boards navigate these tensions by embracing learning, adaptability, and clear strategic focus.



The session takes a deeper dive into what makes a high-performing leadership team, inviting participants to reflect on the characteristics of good leaders and the importance of collaboration. Through lively discussion and interactive chat exercises, David explores the anatomy of successful boards: clarity of purpose, discipline, balance, external awareness, and a strong ‚Äútone from the top.‚Äù He also examines how values, behaviour, and strategic decisions must align to shape organisational culture. With insights from leadership expert Simon Sinek and a closing reflection on how directors can drive sustainable progress, this session leaves attendees better equipped to lead with purpose, authenticity and impact.

This is an online session. The link to this will be sent out to those with confirmed bookings ahead of time.

Click here to view David's LinkedIn profile

Events.description:
We are excited to invite you to explore the potential that the Tech+Tour facility might provide your industry sector: @ Fareham College Bishopsfield Road, Fareham PO14 1NH
¬†

On 23rd July 2025 ‚Äì various times available to suit you! Tech+Tour is an exciting, interactive roadshow initiative designed to ignite career ambition for the Port & Maritime, Logistics, Creative Arts, Health & Social Care and Engineering industries across the Solent region.

Proudly delivered by The South Hampshire College Group in collaboration with 4 local colleges (Brockenhurst College, HTP Apprenticeship College, City of Portsmouth College and The Isle of Wight College) along with the South Coast Institute of Technology and Hampshire Chamber of Commerce, it reaches students at schools, community and guides groups as well as a variety of sector-specific events and careers fairs to bring cutting-edge technology to life and showcase innovation across the Solent‚Äôs key sectors. Visitors experience the latest equipment hands on, including AI, Augmented and Virtual Reality, robotics, 3D printing and autonomous remote operations center; breaking down outdated stereotypes to raise aspirations to modern, dynamic career pathways and to fill current skills gaps that exist across across the Solent region.
¬†

Launched in 2023, Tech+Tour has already made a significant impact, visiting over 160 regional events, engaging with more than 25,000 people in the process! In 2025 alone, 64% of visitors said the experience made them consider a career in one of our featured industries.

Taking up our invitation gives you the opportunity to:

¬∑ explore how your sector might be shared with the region‚Äôs talent pool, giving them experience of new equipment used in your field.

¬∑ explore potential workforce upskilling opportunities.

¬∑ feed into the exciting skills provision by sharing industry needs from an outreach perspective.

¬∑ share employers‚Äô changing needs to reach and inspire your talent pipeline.

¬∑ access apprenticeship advice from our specialist apprenticeship team.

¬∑ engage with T-level and work experience opportunities to help grow your business!
¬†

This initiative bridges skills gaps and is helping to build a future-ready workforce. Employers play a vital role in this journey, and we welcome you to collaborate, showcase your innovation(s), and inspire the next generation together!

For more information on the Tech+Tour project, please visit our website https://get-on-board.co.uk/ To enquire, please contact Hello@get-on-board.co.uk
